Reviews.Title: “Good !”
Reviews.Author: TopnotchMarseille
Reviews.Content: Hotel Granados 83: Good, good, good! I was there on a business trip for one night in Barcelona... Nice design, smart use of space... Clean, friendly staff... Red rose in the room at night.... Good bathroom... Appropriate pricing... Good location close to subway... Would go back to Hotel Granados 83, for sure...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Happy042
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a four day break at this Hotel in Barfcelona. Found the hotel to be in a great location within walking distance to all tourist sites, The hotel itself was very comfortable and clean we had a lovely room on the second floor. The reception staff were most helpful on our first day they gave us a street map and directions into the city. We found the breakfast very good with a excellent buffet breakfast also a cooked breakfast was also available. Restaurant staff very helpful and pleasant. Did not encounter any problem made by previous reviewers. Would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and will have no hesitation in staying here again should we visit Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location, but”
Reviews.Author: LBerkeley
Reviews.Content: Room choice is important here. Our first room was small and had no windows while our friends had a lovely room with windows and style. We asked for a change of rooms and were given a great room the next day and on our return a week later. We can't say enough good things about the staff. Everyone was helpful, engaging, friendly and efficient. The location is excellent. Lots of things to do nearby and within walking distance, near metro, and out of the bustle. Be warned-there is no wifi and that became annoying since every other place we stayed in Spain not only had wifi but it was free.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with minor drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: Phoonzang
Reviews.Content: That would be a classic 3.5 star rating, as there were too many small things that were not "good", but the overall stay was more pleasant than just "acceptable". The Hotel itself has a nice design, the lobby and the room had a nice touch, not too artsy, but still not just a standard Hotel design. The location is also very nice, in a quiet part of L'exiample, walking distance from Placa Catalunya and Sagrada Familia, and a lot of nice bars and restaurants in the neighbourhood. The room was not too big, but sufficient, nicely furnished and comfortable. The bathroom was nothing too special, and here the age showed a little: The tiling was a little worn (but not shabby, just not perfectly clean like I'd ecpect from a 4*S Hotel) and there were no practical hanger for the towels (which also looked a little worn). The room itself also showed some very minor signs of wear and tear, very minor things such as chipped paint, strangely behaving light switches etc. Nothing that would really spoil the stay, but these minor things add up, leaving behind a somewhat tainted impression. The room had a small balcony, which was very nice, however there's a light on it, bright as the sun, which could not be turned off manually but was switched off aroun 1 am. We never went to bed before that time, but I can imagine that if you need a good nights sleep and have to get up early, this can be bothersome. The view an the back yard is not too nice, as to be expected in a residential area, and there's a schoolyard (or similar) which was a little noisy on the weekday. The service was alawys very friendly and helpful, there was always somebody who spoke good English. The bar on the roof was very nice, unfortunately due to high walls, there was no view from there. All in all a pleasent stay which could have been a bit better, we got a bargain on the room rates so it was well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but..........”
Reviews.Author: GKLewis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grenados 83 for three nights with some friends to celebrate our birthdays. The staff were warm and friendly, the hotel and rooms were modern and clean. It is located in a good part of the city for sightseeing, about a 10 minute walk from Catalunya Plaza. Unfortunately, breakfast was a huge disappointment. The restaurant is rather small and one would think easy to keep functional but alas, no !!! 6 of us went for breakfast and the service was not good to put it mildly. We had to wait for tables and when we ordered breakfast it was hit and miss if it arrived at all . Two more friends joined us and waited ages for the waitress to clear and then set up the wrong table !!!! What a shambles. needless to say we never went for breakfast there again, we used the bar opposite the hotel, less than half the price and the service was quick and efficient. Grenados take note !!!! All in all a good, if rather pricey hotel but avoid the breakfasts !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lynn M
Reviews.Content: Our stay with Hotel Granados 83 was delightful! The staff was very friendly and helpful with all of our needs! We happen to be guests during the Labor Strike; which was a common experience for us. The staff was wonderfully informative and helped avoid any possible issues. The rooms were clean and comfortable. There is a great Attic lounge that should not be missed on the 8th floor. We loved the restaurant across the street; Taverna de Meditarranean which ended up being our final stop most nights. I would definite

Reviews.Title: “My pick for my business trips to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: idelgado
Reviews.Content: It simply has everything: nice service, nice rooms. It makes a very good impression from the outside for it is so beautiful and stylish but also from the inside. The only downside is that it does not have a business centre.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: cumbriansKendal
Reviews.Content: Extremely helpful staff. Quiet location but just a couple of blocks from the Metro. Lots of good places to eat. we enjoyed a very good meal at a very fair price at Pulpa one block down from hotel. We will certainly visit again we we next come to Barcelona to visit our son Didn't use the pool as winter on our visit. It is a decent length but only narrow in width. Breakfast good but we paid only 10 Euros on a special deal. From the airport use the Aerobus to Placa catalunya and then Metro Green Line to Diagonal Only real negative is free wifi is ony for one hour per day which is a bit mean particularly if you want to do your emails in a morning and an evening on the same day like us Rooms at back have balcony for 2 and get afternoon evening sun

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend, fantastic Style.”
Reviews.Author: DarrylHa
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I am here on business and this is one of the best hotels I have stayed at, and that includes hotels at twice the price. The style and architecture of the place is amazing. I loved the place so much the first time I was here I knew I wanted to bring my wife. I think Barcelona is an amazing place and wanted to see more so managed to convince my wife to come here for a short break. We will stay in a duplex room in March so I will give you an update then, but based on past experience I know it will be good. The standard rooms are fantastic and more than sufficient with loads of style. If you are looking for a place to stay in Barcelona I would look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Fassion in action”
Reviews.Author: Max120368
Reviews.Content: Very very contemprorary hotel with fassionable accomodation for modern metrosexual people! The location is nice due to the distant access to the major attractions of the City but very calm in day light and very energetic in night - life - nice pubs, restaurants

Reviews.Title: “chic in barsa”
Reviews.Author: durjay
Reviews.Content: My office booked it for me since I got bored of my previous hotel where I stayed every single time I visited Barcelona. What a pleasant surprise - I loved the hotel. The room is very small though and if one is used to staying in bigger hotels then this is not going to rock your boat. It did for me since I was in a mood to be lost and this was the perfect setting. Pick any loft in SOHO, NYC and that is it!!! The hotel charged 20euros extra on check in since I wanted a room with a balcony (I smoke) but then I realized most of the rooms have balconies. But that is OK and I did not mind since I was paying very little for the 3 nights I stayed there (I am used to spending more when in Barcelona). The room was very clean and the bathroom though small was cosy and worked well. It had a nice panel with jets.I liked the wooden panelling and overall it was cosy. I did not try any food at the hotel so cannot comment on it but the place lots of nice features. Location is also as good as it gets and you are very close to everything. Why four stars ---- the internet never worked. I paid for a card like I usually do but it just refused to work. It works in patches when you are in the lobby but it just did not work at all when in the room all four days. Its totally business hotel and the staff could be a bit cold too. Overall a "feel good" feeling is present. I would not go back but that is because I travel to Barcelona every second month and like exploring. If you are touring and do not need internet you would love it. The lady diagonally opposite serves great breakfast from her cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable overall”
Reviews.Author: Design123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights just before Xmas 2011 during which time the hotel was very well priced. The hotel is very stylish though a little older than some of the Barcelona design hotels. The general feel of the place is moody with pools of light and dark throughout. We had seen this hotel on a previous trip and were interested to see what it was like. We were not disappointed. The room was very masculine in feel with much of the furniture made from sheet steel but this is softenend by the use of exotic woods and warm exposed brick. My only criticism, and it is a minor one, is that the bathroom was a little worn in places, inparticular the marble sink had rust stains round the drain which were unpleasant. Other than this it was a really good overall experience and I would definitely like to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent holiday hotel”
Reviews.Author: LisaMarieRo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel December 24th and 25th and had an excellent experience. We got there around 8 am after an overnight flight from NYC. We were told there would be a room available in about an hour, and so they held our bags while we walked around and had breakfast. The room was incredibly quiet on the 3rd floor (facing the street), very clean and the staff was great. It's about a 15 minute walk to Sagrada Familia and a very easy subway ride (or longer walk) to the old part of the city - the subway is just a few blcoks away and easy to navigate). The staff was very helpful with directions and maps and very gracious. We had no issues with this hotel. The price was great as I don't think there were many people there at this time (but check prices as it greatly increased when I checked to see if we could book a room on January 2nd) It was a great place to land after flying into Barcelona on Christmas Eve.

Reviews.Title: “New York Loft in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Publius-DC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our stay at the Granados. The staff was always friendly and gracious, and helped us call ahead to confirm reservations or take care of things for us. I had read some of the other reviews and was on guard for poor service or dirty rooms, but we had nothing but positive experiences. The room was small, but nicely appointed. The Eastern art and exposed brick were trendy, though perhaps a bit 90s, but it had the feel of staying in a New York loft at a cool friend's house, which is appealing. We were happy with it for the price we paid in the low-season (check prices, because they seem to have a great deal of variation depending on when you are visiting). I was more than happy to pay for the room at the winter price, but would have been disappointed had we been paying high season rates for what we had. The location was convenient, near good restaurants, walking distance to high-end shopping, and just a few blocks from the metro - from which you can easily get to anywhere. Downsides were the views were either a construction site from the front of the hotel, or looking back into an inner court-yard of the surrounding block complete with people hanging out their laundry. The breakfast buffet was adequate, but not astounding. The mattress was thin, particularly by luxury hotel standards. I did not like the cloying smell of the incense or fragrance they use in the lobby, made it smell like a 70's shag-pad too musky and sweet, but that's only a minor complaint. All and all well recommended for the winter, but you may want to comparison shop during the tourist season when prices get unreasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Barcelona home”
Reviews.Author: Carol0343
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an Interesting, dramatic modernistic motif: first-rate conversion of an old hospital, with tasteful decoration balancing high-tech. Ulttramodern, very well-equipped rooms, though a bit dark. Ask for one with a balcony, or if it's in your budget, spring for a duplex suite. There's virtually no street noise, and many excellent restaurants within an easy, safe stroll. Barcelona is a walkable city, so the distance to the Raval and Bari Gothic turned out to be no problem, and many Gaudi sites are within a half mile. The hotel offers all every convenience except free WiFi, but there's a computer for guests to use in the lobby. Entire staff was friendly and helpful. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful unique design hotel, great location, attentive service, great value.”
Reviews.Author: Gosia E
Reviews.Content: This is been our second stay at this hotel and hopefully there will be more. After having a great experience during our previous stay in July,we booked this hotel again and it did not dissapoint. Just a few special things to describe their great service: we arrived early in the morning and rooms were not ready yet ( check in time is at 2pm), we were invited to stay in a smaller room, where we had a chance to refresh before our room was ready. On a rainy day, the front desk had umbrellas available to guests. Little things, that mean so much. We definitely recommend to take advantage of their duplex suites, especially when the weather is nice,since they come with semi private decks and swimming pools. Our last stay, the duplex had 3 levels, with 2 full bathrooms which was definitely very convenient. The hotel is located in a very friendly area, couple of blocks from Passeig de Gracia, La Rambla,Diagonal, all within walking distance. And this is for all smal dog owners: the hotel is very dog friendly and just around the corner there is a great pet spa/boutique. It is called Kity's Palace and their owners are very helpful in selecting perfect clothing/accessories for your furry friends. Overall, great experience in Barcelona again. Can't wait to go back and definitely stay at Granados 83.

Reviews.Title: “Kind but not professional”
Reviews.Author: 142KATE
Reviews.Content: Hotel is new & modern and the staff are kind but ….. Receptionists : They do not have enough information. They often needed to use internet to answer my basic/simply questions. Room : It is modern but I could smell something such as cleaning product or chemical. And some big brown stains stay in bath tub. I was not happy for their average shampoo & soap. Breakfast : Food quality is good and they are delicious but only 2 staff work and they have to work for reception, bringing foods and making tables etc. Staff are too busy to give customers good services. I could not eat enough food as food plates in buffet bar were often empty everyday as they did not top-up. I suggest hiring more staff for breakfast. And they should not use a chemical spray to wipe my next table during my eating.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, neat design”
Reviews.Author: spotuv
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights in November '10. Location is great, the bar and pool is cool. Definitely worth spending money in.

Reviews.Title: “nice!”
Reviews.Author: Algahu
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in the family room,excellent! But the price of breakfast is a little to much. The location is very easy to walk to the paseo de Gracia and plaza Catalunya, the personal service very kind. Only was disturb children that early play en scream inthe terrase for brekfast, our room was next to.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and central”
Reviews.Author: sarinopoli
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this stylish small hotel with a friend. the location was perfect: very central,but on a calm side street. We walked almost everywhere and enjoyed sitting down with a glass of wine on the small roof terrace in theevening when back at the hotel. The rooms are modern and spacious enough, even though I'd say they are slightly small. Good value for money considering the central location. I'd go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location and design”
Reviews.Author: Davek2008
Reviews.Content: This hotel is kind of a boutique hotel, for people who seek a good location in Barcelona. The rooms size are ok and the price is average. The breakfeast is poor, and the swimmimg pool and pool area very small.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant staying, but at some points...”
Reviews.Author: TanVu
Reviews.Content: It was my first holiday together with my boyfriend and Granados 83 was our second "sub-trip". It's quite impressive the way they tried to arrange things in such a central small spot in Barcelona. We were in a beach hotel right before going here, so the smell, the atmosphere... everything was quite pleasant and relaxing. The receptionists, the services, in general were pretty good. I had the feeling that they tried to do their best to make you feel welcome in Barcelona. We were asked if we went here for the first time, and were kindly offered a Barca map when we admitted so. But... Amongst all very friendly staff at the hotel, a waiter at the breakfast seemed so rude to us( especially when I experienced a kinda "serving culture" at this hotel - which really pleased me). We were coming to breakfast about 15 minutes before breakfast time ended (which only means they will clean the buffet table up and you will not be able to pick up anything more). There were only few table left. The guy came to us , asking "do you know that you can only eat for 15 mins?" in a way that I tried to persuade myself, "his English is not good so he's just trying to be direct" and kindly replied with a smile, "yes, we do". We were left alone there, until I saw him coming to a woman siting at the back-side table and asking if she would like to have some more orange juice, and later pouring some water for her when she said so. Then he came to another table and asked them, and fulfilled their requirements. But not to us. 15 mins later, breakfast time ended, but few more people came in the room and picked things to eat. He did not say anything, except offering their required drink later, but again, not to us. And that really made me wonder if it's because we're the only Asia-origin in the room?

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: jeff g
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous boutique hotel in the BEST location. The architecture of this place is marvelous. So clever, quirky and interesting. Bery comfortable buplex room with a semi private rooftop pool (shared by only 2 other rooms!). Staff very friendly, helpful. Prices were great considering the amazing amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Almost excellent”
Reviews.Author: SamTeeeee
Reviews.Content: Modern and stylish, great location, nice room and friendly staff. However a couple of small things let it down. The standard room features a large double bed which is actually two single beds pushed together. The breakfast buffet is very expensive and pretty limited, and the waiters serving breakfast were very slow and rude. You cant borrow and iron or ironing board, you have to pay for their laundry service. Apart from that its a pretty nice place!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice design hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1060Wien
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice during a short trip to Barcelona. Will come back definitely next time: small but very clean a superb designed rooms and interior in a very calm part of Barcelona despite very near to all the fantastic attractions, restaurants and sites in this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: SKim78
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel to explore L'Eixample and most of the Gaudi architecture. It would be a bit too far if you're planning on walking down to the beach or the port. This is a great hotel but make sure to book the duplex suite. It comes with a semi private patio and pool that is only shared by you and 4 other suites so you can enjoy it during siesta or at the end of the night. The room was beyond lovely. Great space and very nicely decorated. The staff is super friendly and helpful. The only complaint and this is a tiny one was that the sealant wasn't working on the bathroom shower, so it would leak a bit on the floor whenever you bathed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: kenschwartz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the good fortunate to choose Granados 83 hotel. We stayed at the hotel following several nights in Poland, Berlin, Nice and Marsielle. We booked a room with a pool (609) which was very nice. The hotel and exspecially the (well trained) staff exceeded our expectations. Our experience at the Granados 83 made our trip to Barcelona exceptional.......we hope to be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and convenient boutique hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: canmark
Reviews.Content: Hotel Granados 83 is a stylish boutique hotel situated on a fairly quiet street only a few blocks from the chic shopping street Passeig de Gracia and Gaudi's striking Casa Mila (La Pedrera). Service is pleasant and rooms are attractively designed. Rates are fairly reasonable for this calibre of hotel. Well suited for singles of couples looking for something modern and sophisticated--but not for traditionalists.

Reviews.Title: “Cool design and great location”
Reviews.Author: Schiepchen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our first wedding anniversary. The things we really loved about this place were the location: central, close to Metro, good restaurants in the neighborhood but still quiet; the design and facilities of the common areas as well as our room: use of great materials like wood and leather combined with steel and glass, comfortable beds and sofas, bathrobes and slippers, etc., the quality of the breakfast (freshly squeezed orange juice, great ham, eggs cooked to order,...) one could have outdoors on a patio and the friendly staff at the reception. Apart from all the great things about it we think the hotel needs a bit of improvement regarding the service at breakfast. We were never asked for drink refills at breakfast and it was hard to draw the waiters attention as soon as we were served once. And WiFi should definitely be free for more than one hour a day. We did not use the rooftop terrace but it looked very nice (pool is very small though) and like a good place to relax. We also didn't try the hotel's restaurant for dinner but can recommend "Paco Meralgo" for Tapas and "Osmosis" for a lovely special occasion dinner.

Reviews.Title: “First visit to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: lavisse
Reviews.Content: A small chic hotel that we visited with our daughters aged 25 and 23. The hotel is a great location, residential but only a fifteen minute walk to the sights. The rooms were clean and very comfortable with an excellent shower and comfortable beds which were very welcome after a long day sight seeing. We didn't eat in the hotel as there are lots of bars and restaurants very close by , offering good value meals . The hotel has a roof top bar and pool (very tiny ) but good to cool off or dangle your feet in while you enjoy a drink. All the staff were helpful and extremely accommodating . The feel of the hotel was New York loft which was great for us but I wouldn't have thought it was child friendly , too much glass and too many sharp edges. For a short city break a hotel worth visiting. 25 & 23.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have wished for more”
Reviews.Author: shellybarker
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a surprise for my boyfriends 30th and I was so pleased I did! After reading the reviews and looking at hundreds of hotels on line I settled on this hotel. Location - brilliant nicely away from the 'manic' Rambles but close enough to allow you to walk everywhere. 10mins into the centre and a further 15mins to the beach / harbour. In the area there were lots of lovely restaurants and cafe's, we were advised by the hotel to either eat close or by the harbour and not in the main centre, we stuck to this and enjoyed our meals. Hotel - the hotel is small and friendly, I booked one of the duplex suits meaning we had a the semi-private terrace which was only shared by four other rooms and was brilliant, each of the four seating areas was secluded by plants and made the stay even more enjoyable. The roof terrace was also very nice and relaxing Food - we didn't eat at the hotel, instead we went out and enjoyed the local cuisine I had read a few bad comments about the beds, I have to say this seems to have been addressed as I was very happy with the quality of the bed and bedding and I am a nightmare sleeper! The black out blinds helped a lot too Our room was cleaned every day and both towels and bedding changed whenever requested. Barcelona - what an amazing place, the city, harbour and beach made it a perfect get away. Be prepared to eat late - 10pm is normal and bars are all open until about 2pm with clubs even later (so glad we stayed out of the main centre as I can imagine it gets very noisy at night) Bus Tour - we paid €60 for two of us for two days and to be honest I thought it was a waste as we only used it twice and this was simply to get back from the beach to the centre. It was far to hot to sit in traffic on the top of a bus and we are much happier to walk around and really see the place we came to visit and not view it from afar Metro - big thumbs up, once you know where you are and where you need to get to then this is simple, quick and really cheap, 1 single ticket to any location €1.90 All in all great experience, i would go back to Barcelona and Granados 83 tomorrow if i could

Reviews.Title: “very friendly, we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Roshan S
Reviews.Content: The first thing I wanted to say, is a big thanks to the staff. They were always very friendly and helpful. They felt like friends. Me and my friend stayed there a week, leaving this morning, and agreed we would definately come back. Location is great, not far from cafes, restaurants and the metro. And not far at all from la rambla and other attractions. Hotel is nice, clean, free internet. swimming pool & gym a little small, but was not a problem. This was our first time in barcelona, and it gave us the perfect first impression. Would recommend it, had an amazing time and part of that is due to the great service at our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great design, good location, comfortable, something missing though...”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryHotelExpert
Reviews.Content: Product: Design is great in common areas and rooms. Location is very central in Eixample, close to everywhere you want to go in the area, lots of nice restaurants and cafes in the hood. Contrary to other reviews on this site I found the beds to be quite comfortable (single beds are somewhat small though). Great marble bathroom with nice shower, good amenities. Breakfast buffet is small but very nice and high-quality, you can have it in the outside patio which is quite nice. To improve: gym is ridiculously small, offering no space for more than one person at a time, no towels nor water available. It is unacceptable for this category of a hotel (4*S). Wi-Fi Internet only free for 1 hour a day is not enough - of course there is cable Internet available but when it does not work...I mentioned at the reception my cable Internet was not working in the room a couple of times and the only answer was "it must be your computer" - blaming the guest! No one tried to understand, or help or offered another free hour of Wi-Fi - this is all I needed! Service: friendly and nice throughout the stay but needs to be more reactive - listening to guests, understanding problems and reacting to prevent further dissatisfcation (notice I am not even asking for proactive service! which would be too far from current practice). Some training for staff on service culture would be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel option on quiet street yet close to all the best shopping spots and sttractions”
Reviews.Author: Tanya0810
Reviews.Content: I love this small hotel. I stay there when we go to Barcelona on business. It has a modern feel with interesting art in every floor and inside each room while still being practical and comfortable. The room might be too small if you plan a long stay or if you come with kids. But if traveling alone or as a couple it is perfect. It is located close to las Ramblas and major attractions like las Pedreras. Shopping is literally minutes away The hotel staff is friendly, helpful and can recommend many good restaurants close to the hotel. You can also eat at their restaurant; the lunch menu is outstanding. Just ask for instructions on how to use the phone and TV in the room. There are no instructions anywhere and you will find it hard to figure out how to reach reception, work the air-conditioning or TV. Prices are very affordable depending on the day of the week or season. Call them for rates

Reviews.Title: “They Keep Getting Better and Better”
Reviews.Author: remoazul
Reviews.Content: At Granados83, they keep raising the bar, and it just gets better and better. The reception staff is amongst the friendliest in Barcelona and perhaps Spain. Alberto Ranz is the person responsible for managing such a fine group, including the face of the Granados83: "Camara", Mr. Ranz deserves special congratulations for doing a fantastic job at welcoming and dealing with their guests. The hotel is located in a central area, yet, and we love this !!, you feel that you are away from the hustle and bustle of Barcelona and in our own neighborhood, with its corner cafeterias, restaurants, and, YES, the pharmacy !! If you don't mind a two-three block walk to Paseo de Gracia or Ramblas, this is definitely the hotel for you. I surely recommend our home in Barcelona to all !!! Greg , the property director must be commended for a job well done !!! Will return many many times !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: SCRR75 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Granados 83 is a modern hotel which is impressively decorated. Staff were all extremely helpful and the room was spacious, comfortable and had a small balcony. It was also air-conditioned and had an electric blind, which meant sleeping was very comfortable despite the very hot weather. The hotel features a good-sized dining area, free internet access and a small, rooftop pool and bar, although the pool does close at 7:00pm. The hotel is in the middle of the city. La Ramblas and the old city are within easy walking distance, and there are many shops and restaurants in the immediate area. The nearest metro station is just round the corner, and the trip from Barcelona airport only takes about 30 - 40 minutes with one change. We loved the hotel and will definitely stay again when we return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: clara50
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Bracelona for a conference and choose that area because of shopping and walking around in the evening. The Hotel Granados is very convenient, it is very confortable and clean. The breakfast is also very nice. Overall experience: RECOMMENDED!

Reviews.Title: “Staff nice enough just need good training. Building getting a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: Jwakrod
Reviews.Content: This place was great three years ago,but things are slipping. We stayed in a loft style with a semi private pool great for sitting in after a day shopping. Balcony door doesn't close fridge door fell off power points falling out of Walls cracks in mirrors remote controls not working. Rooms cleaned during lunch time when shops closed and wanting a rest! Balconies not cleaned. And forget trying to iron ur own shirt or have it pressed in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “my favorite in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: e_onthego
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for two nights prior to a cruise. Of the three places I've now stayed in the city, this is my favorite one. The things I liked - decent room size with plenty of storage; room darkening shades; breakfast was very good (we obtained an inclusive rate); and front desk staff - actually all staff members - were very friendly. As for location, it is a few blocks off the main path, but found this to be a non-event. It was plenty close to transportation (metro), and actually liked being in a quieter area. My only dislike seems to be a design trend for the city, where things are done for style versus function. The square toilet, oversize sink, etc all look great, but practical? Not really, but easy enough to live with a few days. Overall though, give this place a try.

Reviews.Title: “hotel is o.k. but value for money is not”
Reviews.Author: Martin02458
Reviews.Content: room is too small: no space for the day-pillows - only the floor, problems with air condition, problems with the room door, for wlan they want extra money (exceeding 60 min) which is not normal in this price range; some members of recepcion do not speak sufficient english or spanish

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay…with caveats”
Reviews.Author: TocquevilleBluegrass
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and location for sightseeing, restaurants and transportation. A few blocks off the main thoroughfare and smaller stylish rooms provided much better value and satisfaction for us. The staff tries to be helpful and friendly. Although we encountered relatively minor problems, the front desk staff worked to resolve them as soon as they could within their constraints. We would still recommend subject to caveats. Some caveats from our experience to keep in mind: 1. We made reservations well in advance. We checked-in late morning and dropped off our luggage until return when our room would be ready late afternoon. However, upon our return, we were escorted to the handicap room just a few feet away from the front desk on the lobby level. There was a lack of privacy from the window, the noise from the lobby carried over, and the ventilation from the kitchen below created a slight odor in the room. We were told we could not move to a new room until the next day; likely due to a large group leaving the next day. There was some confusion about the room change, but the staff seemed to be sensitive to our preferences. 2. The Internet service is slow. With rarely a wait, the business services area consisted of a counter with relatively slow service to load web sites for general info and to check email. One hour of free Wifi is offered from the rooms. We found it fine for email. Voice only Skype was often interrupted and we often reverted to chat only. Don’t even think about Skype video. 3. The front desk staff was familiar with the basic tourist information, but was likely not as well informed as we would have thought. One person indicated only 3 weeks of experience. We quickly learned more from other tourists in the lobby or tour books. But otherwise, the staff wanted to help putting us in the right direction. 4. The staff might have educated us better on the various services and amenities in the hotel. For instance, not until the last of our three night stay did we notice a nice roof top bar, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great neighbourhood, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: schiocco
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 5 nights at Granados 83 - booked a deal through a travel agent and secured free breakfasts which were always good (plenty of food and variety, lots of fresh fruit, nice coffee) We found the room to be very stylish and to our taste. It made me think of a posh bachelor pad. My fiance agreed. The room was cleaned to a high standard daily and the amenities were good (although slightly 'style over substance' e.g. bathroom door a bit sticky and light system a little confusing). My only annoyance was that the toiletries provided, although looked nice, smelled oddly savoury (I thought of vegetable stir fry every time I used them!) - not appealing to me, but that's probably just my personal taste. The location is excellent. We attempted dinner in a different neighbourhood one night, but it did not live up to 'home'. Plenty of great bars and restaurants. Taller de Tapas on La Ramblas was our favourite. The hotel is walking distance to many sights, although the train/underground is just as easy and very affordable. The construction works at the junction outside the hotel did not bother us. Our room overlooked them on the 3rd floor, but they only worked waking hours and it served the make the road below pedestrianised and therefore remarkably quiet. We used the rooftop terrace on several days to relax after a day of sightseeing. The pool is too small to really swim in, and am told it was very chilly. The seating is comfortable though to sit and read a book in the sun or shade. 3 EUR for a glass for coke. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good...but minor irritants that begin to add up”
Reviews.Author: Man_of_Leisure66
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is excellent in that the road it stands on is nice, quiet, tree-lined and in the heart of an area full of bars and restaurants. However, bear in mind that just outside the front of the hotel there is currently a shaft being sunk for a high speed rail service, plus a large vacant lot opposite looks ripe for development. Both could of course affect future access and noise levels. The hotel is boutique and the staff helpful and friendly. It's well styled though sometimes detracting from functionality: the motion sensor doors you must enter to get to your room; the dimmer/fader lighting system in the room that we failed to master in 4 nights; the glass and chrome bathroom door that didn't fit and had be to be hauled open and shut; the trendy sink that was not conducive to a shave or face wash... Other minor irritants were room cleaning which I mentioned to no avail; a wobbly loo seat. Plus over-priced extras: 17€ for breakfast; 15€ for TV entertainment and a charge for wi-fi in the room. The biggest annoyance was having to pay 8€ for a small beer from the mini bar which the local corner shop sold for a tenth of the price. Come on amigos...que pasa?!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and very modern”
Reviews.Author: burkesn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and clean and an excellent value compared to other hotels in the area. I was originally skeptical because of the 3-star rating, but everything was as good a quality as most 5-star hotels. The rooms were small, but you expect that in Europe. The location is good, but is not right in the middle of the historic center of town. The benefit is that you're not surrounded by tourists and get more of the city's feel. The main tourist attractions are a short walk, or quick metro stop away. The one thing I did not enjoy about our stay was the smell. This hotel has a very modern design, but it had a very strong odor which is piped into the entire hotel. I think the smell is meant to enhance the modern feel of the hotel, but to me it smelled like they had sprayed axe body spray everywhere. Maybe some people will appreciate it, but for me it was too much.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool and modern hotel, EXCELLENT front desk staff, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: ddsnj
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Spain and stayed in Derby hotels in Madrid and Barcelona and were incredibly happy with our choice. Granados 83 is very cool and modern. The rooms are spacious and appear to be newly renovated. The bathrooms are also very modern, spacious and clean. There is a nice rooftop bar and swimming pool here at this hotel, which also have a great ambience. The location is great with 3 of the Gaudi sites within a short walking distance. Public transportation is also very easy, the hotel is within a short walk (5 minutes) of the commuter rail line, the Metro, and a 7 minute walk to the RENFE. The best part of this hotel, really, is the staff. They helped us each morning plan our site-seeing route, gave us lots of dining recommendations, and made reservations for us as needed. They were so kind and eager to help. The one quirk is that they don't provide an iron upon request, instead they ask you to use their laundry service which can become quite costly. No big deal, we just were a little wrinkled while we stayed there. We most definitely will stay here if we travel back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: RJMCA10
Reviews.Content: It is a great location. It is a bit of a walk to the Ramblas, but we viewed that as a plus. It was much more quiet and there lots of restaurants on the street. I would still request a room away from the street for a better sleep. The staff were very friendly and helpful. An extended coffee service would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “nice place but we had a poor experience”
Reviews.Author: Viajero-Alfa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Granados from May 19 to 21, everything went well except the last night. My spouse paid the bill with a credit card and requested a wake up call at 5:00am as out flight was at 9:00am. Close to 7:00am I woke up, by accident, and immediately woke up my spouse, got dressed, went downstairs to ask for a cab (the complaining we left it for later on) and we reached the airport on time except, of course, that we didn't have time to dress and get cleaned appropriately, like take a shower, etc. Via e-mail we complained to the management, they explained that the receptionist were too busy (at 5:00am?) and never apologized...

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Excellent tasteful boutique hotel on quiet street in central Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: washbrol
Reviews.Content: Granados 83 is an incredibly great choice, if you like intriguing artsy boutique hotels. Even amidst a city that is renowned for them. Particularly great value for the affordable price. In a small building down a quiet street in central Barcelona, away from the gaudy tourist strips and amidst trendy restaurants and bars frequented by locals, Granados 83 has created an artful new experience from floor to cieling. Glass elevators set against an exposed brick the entire height of the building. The rooms had dark hardwood floors, oversized headboards, custom silestone showers, in-laid sinks, statues/artwork set into the shower and living space. The best? Intimate rooftop plunge pool, with bar and gentle house music playing throughout the day and evening! I was in bliss. Free internet access below the lobby. The only downside was a surprisingly/extremely thin queen mattress, almost as if it were a pull-out sofa bed. Shocking, since so much attention to details is executed upon so geniusly in every other element of the guest rooms and lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: WrldTrvlr2011
Reviews.Content: Just a block from the metro and another block to La Rambla Catalunya, this hotel is located in a great a convenient area. The hotel itself is pretty cool. Neat modern architectural and decorating approach. The desk people were very helpful and friendly. They do need to do better on having the room keys work. We had to have ours replaced twice, and the key machine wasn't working so they had to have someone let us into our room several times. Very inconvenient. Maid service was ok. One day room still wasn't made up when we returned after 4:00pm. Automatic hallway doors needed lubrication. Door noise was easily audible in room -- every time the door opened. Nonetheless, the room, the bed and the bath were quite nice for the price, and the location was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “The best we can imagine in Barcelona!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kaarina-and-Heikki
Reviews.Content: We took a long weekend visit to Barcelona in December 2009 and we just fell in love with the hotel. Amazing quality for a decent price! The location was great (a metro station 5 min walk away) and the most delighting was style the hotel was decorated and designed with - just loved the "eye of the designer"! The staff was friendly and helpful. I think one of the small details we paid attention to (and maybe irrelevant to many) were the cool staff t-shirts at breakfast restaurant and the breakfast music selection! This indeed was the first hotel in the world were we were listening Mew while eating delicious breakfast!!! ...and we have traveled a lot of places, Africa, Europe, Asia and North-America! We are planning a one-year wedding anniversary trip to Barcelona and we are seriously considering Granados 83 for the place to stay! Warm recommendations to anyone planning a trip to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in a good area”
Reviews.Author: Brit_82
Reviews.Content: we just stayed at the hotel for a romantic trip to Barcelona. the hotel was good, we enjoyed it. Positive sides: - nice and helpful staff - very good breakfast - clean, new towles and bed sheets every day or after your wish. - safe in room, easy in use - short walk to paseig de Gracia. and a lot of good restaurants close by. - you can walk from the hotel to almost everything (if you dont mind walking) negative side: - small bed (length just 190, which is quite short for a scandinavian) and a bit hard. - they did not fill up the things u use in bathroom, like tissues and shower cap. - small pool and not a really good view from the roof - very load from the hall into the room, you could hear what people said when they where in the hall outside the room.

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable but clean”
Reviews.Author: MJE1977
Reviews.Content: My room had a light in it the size of a brick in surface area, that remains on at all times in the sleeping area by the bed. The receptionist who was quite stand-offish with me, told me that it was a safety feature that cannot be switched off. In my room it was a metre from my bed and kept me awake, but in the room that members of my family had, it was in a separate corridor that you could not see from the bed. The telephone by my bed did not work. When I told the receptionist he simply told me that I was wrong and that it did work. The porter came with me and confirmed it did not work and it remained out of service throughout my stay. The telephone in the toilet did work though. The music system in my room was faulty and the volume was broken. The porter confirmed this but it remained broken throughout my stay. There were no instructions on how to use the safe so I asked reception. I was told I was wrong and the instructions were on the door. I went back to my room and double checked and they weren't there. The porter confirmed this and explained to me how to use it. The battery was flashing on the screen as being low so I was lucky to have got my belongings out of it. I asked for an iron to iron my shirt an hour before going out on Saturday night. I was told that there were no irons and ironing boards and that I had to use the laundry service and pay for it to be ironed. The problem was that I would have had to put it in for ironing in the morning if I wanted it ready for 8pm that night. Therefore I could not iron my shirt that was creased from having been in my suitcase. There were no instructions in the room to explain how to use any of the room amenities. The minibar contained small bottles of water that were over 3 Euros each. I did not use the hotel catering. On the positive side the hotel is good to look at with a stylish interior design. The housekeeper does a great job in keeping the small rooms very clean and tidy and should be congratulated on being one of the only positive things in this hotel. The hotel is not in my opinion worth the star rating that it has and I would not stay in this hotel or any Derby Hotel again. I have previously stayed in Hotel Jazz but I thought this looked even nicer when I was booking so thought I would give it a try. It isn't nicer and I will return to Hotel Jazz next time I go to Barcelona, which is at least once a year.

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance”
Reviews.Author: lucyjane68
Reviews.Content: Great location but horrendous at night due to noise in street at weekend until gone 5 a.m. WE had nice sized room but friends had tiny room over looking inner court yard with a bathroom door only half opaque - not good for privacy! Much of decor quite odd - you either like it or not. Very dark. Nearly all staff VERY helpful and friendly - really made us welcome in every way. Rooms very clean as was elsewhere but large fluffy rug in reception hadn't seen a hoover in a long while. Beakfast over priced. You can get deals as rack rate crazy -even deals not brilliant. Very clever web stie photo of roof top pool - a trendy paddling pool really.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: maggworld
Reviews.Content: After having a look on Tripadvisor, we booked directly thru the website of the hotel where we found a good offer. I picked Granados 83 for a long romantic weekend with my husband..And what a wonderful choice!!... from checkin time the staff very professional and friendly made us feel at our ease, our room had a balcony which was perfect for breakfast on the morning an dfor a last drink at night.... the terrasse and the bar are a great spot for coktails and to share a talk with locals and other guests...We would definitely come back in summer to visit again this wonderful city and we will for sure book granados 83,

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Joro70
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, quiet, close to everything( good and safe area). We really enjoyed our stay, we loved it so much! Helpfull staff, friendly and willing to please you.Thanks to them we organized our stay very well( to see Barcelona in 4 days)Fabulous Design, it was a pleasure to go back to the hotel in evenings, very cozy and modern. Rooms a little bit small but amazing and confortable. Fitness and a pool on the roof terrase. Near by (2 min walking) a great place to have breakfast.Good restaurants near by.You can walk in the evening( the area is really good and safe) eat , drink and enjoy! We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A polarising experience: a boutique hotel with cheap beds”
Reviews.Author: candm11
Reviews.Content: Hotel Granados 83 was overall a polarising experience. We stayed for 4 nights in the hotel's duplex room: the best the hotel has to offer. The service was impeccable, the interior is clean and modern. But here comes the catch; despite the staff attentiveness, the good location and the small perks like the semi-private swimming pool we did not get a good night's sleep. Surprisingly management seem to have cut their costs on hotel essentials - a good bed. Bed specs - Queen size bed - Expect a wooden slat bedbase with low flexibility - Mattress is of low quality core coil - Bed frame is unstable and will creak with movement Both my partner and myself are of small body frame. Reception validated with us that all beds of equal quality in all rooms

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: FloridaTravelmum
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Granados 83 three or four times, maybe even five. We keep returning because it seems to do everything right. Location couldn't be better, especially if you enjoy fine dining. There are two very nice places less than a block away (Gresca and La Provenca) and probably another 20 or more within walking distance--of note, Fonda Gaig, Alba Granados, Paco Meralgo, Windsor--I could go on and on. And if you're not of a mind to go out for dinner, the hotel restaurant is perfectly respectable with a limited but nice menu for very reasonable prices served, depending upon the situation either in their lovely downstairs dining room or on their rooftop terrace. Besides being well-located for dining, Granados 83 is in the middle of things for sight-seeing, only a couple of blocks from Passeig de Gracia, a main fashion street and the site of a couple of Gaudi's most famous buildings. It's also well located for access to transportation even though Enric Granados street itself is less-trafficked making for quiet sleeping. Like so much of Barcelona, Granados 83 sports a super-design vibe with small but well laid out rooms, striking entry and glass elevators that let you see how the current renovation into a hotel from an earlier use took shape. Rooms are attired in dark colors but with sparkling white bathrooms with super-modern furnishings. Staff were helpful in arranging dining reservations for us both before our arrival and after we got there and had a chance to scope out some places. The young man who tends their door and hails cabs, etc. couldn't be more friendly, smiling, welcoming and charming. And we love his signature turned up hat. Best of all, if you will be there during off-peak season, Granados 83 offers wonderful rates to keep their rooms filled. We have been there in March and February and have marveled at our good luck in securing rooms in a 4 star + hotel for rates we'd be happy to pay in a 3 star. We travel a lot, in Europe especially, and I'd venture to say have stayed in over 200 hotels over the years. No question but that Granados 83 is among our top 10 favorites and probably on the very top of the list for value for cost.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Rob_de_Maat
Reviews.Content: Second stay at this nicely decorated hotel. Very nice room accomodation, excellent beds. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel at 5 minutes walking distance of the Provenca/Diagonal Metro station could not be better, also for connection to the airport. Our Barcelona Card was put to good use. Will stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good time at Granados 83”
Reviews.Author: Brunitza82
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Granados 83 for 6 nights in early March and chose it after a friend who has visited the city many times recomended the hotel and the region it's in (Eixample). The hotel is brand new and quite stylish, and service is pretty good too: as soon as we got there the guy at the reception opened up a map and showed us how to get to the main spots and also gave us some tips about places to avoid. Management also sent us a bottle of complimentary mineral water with chocolate truffles, very kind gesture! Location is great for anyone who wants to stay away from the buzz and too-touristy attractions of the Ramblas. It's a short walk from Passeig de Gracia, where you find La Pedrera and the Casa Battló. It's also not far from the subway. Only downside is that the walls are pretty thin and we had the bad luck of having 3 excitable teenagers next door, who kept babbling loudly until 1 or 2 am - definitely should have called reception about this, our fault that we didn't. Overall, I had a great stay, would stay there again and will recommend the place to other people.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Surprise”
Reviews.Author: lbezas
Reviews.Content: As every new place you plan to visit, you try to choose the best place at the best rate possible. So we did choosing Granados Hotel in Barcelona. When we arrive the the hotel, we realize that its premises is much better than we could see at the photos published in its webpage. Not only the hotel has a tremendous architecture project but also its in a good conservation as well as it has a great staff to help you every time. Location is also a must at Granados. Close to the best sights in the city and subway station. Moreover, the rate included a fantastic breakfast. Fresh fruits and breads and perfect eggs at your choice. I strongly recommend staying at Granados 83. Luciano

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Gutnik
Reviews.Content: Nice design! Good service! Sympathetic staff! Tasty breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Impressing a hotelier is hard to do, but they did it.”
Reviews.Author: bmbenton
Reviews.Content: I work in the hotel industry for a world leading hotel company. I have stayed in many amazing hotels within our portfolio for both business and leisure travel. A travel partner and I (both from the same company) just completed a weekend excusion to Barcelona from a business trip in Madrid. We stayed at Hotel Granados 83 and had an exceptional time. VERDICT: I would definitely stay there again and would highly recommend to others. Here's the positives on why I liked this hotel: - modern and stylish - great location - extrememly friendly staff, very helpful - amazing roof top lounge area - great value in rate (off season) - rose delivered to room as a part of turn down service - food was pretty good, ate mostly outside the hotel though - great shower - easy booking process - pretty good website Here's the negatives, but still not bad at all for the value: - rooms are small by American standards (on target for European standards) - had to have blinds closed at all times, face rooms/elevator across the atrium - got room service even though I had a "do not disturb" sign out for the day - no free wifi, but they do have free wired internet - free coffee service was only from like 5:15 to 6:30am (or something like that). - I don't get square toilet seats. They are totally uncomfortable. Overall just a great experience, and I hope to get the chance to return and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE OF FRONT DESK INFORMATION”
Reviews.Author: LAGREEK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from Barcelona staying 5 nights at Hotel Granados 83. It was recommended by a friend who lives outside of Barcelona who refers many business associates to this hotel. While we really liked the location and the comfort of our room there were some things that really bothered us about the hotel staff. We originally booked 4 nights and the day before we left my husband called and asked if we could add a night to the front end. He was told no problem that they had availability. Upon our arrival we were told they did not have a double room available, but did put us in a single room and we moved the next night, a bit inconvenient, but they did accommodate us. We asked to talk to the manager and we were told he would be in on Monday morning. On Monday morning we asked for him again and were told he was in meetings and would be back later. Later we were told he was busy so we asked for him to call us; he never did. It appears Mr. Behn was too busy or did not want to bother talking to us. Another problem was the information we received from the front desk. Although everyone was very nice most of the information they gave out was erroneous. The first night I asked about the Magic Fountains near Placa de Espanya and was told there were no shows in the winter. I told the receptionist attendant that my guide books said there were shows Fridays and Saturdays, but she insisted that it was closed. My husband and I decided to go anyway and found the show was in progress. Next my husband asked about getting a wireless connection and they promptly came to our room and gave us a piece of paper with the username and password, but unfortunately the other side of the paper had guest names, reservation numbers, booking agencies along with other information, but the most troubling was that is also had their CREDIT CARD NUMBERS! We brought it home and shredded it. Another day we asked what time a particular restaurant opened up and without looking it up the gentleman at the desk told us 1:30. It is a very popular lunch spot so we wanted to get their early as they did not take reservations. When we got there at 1:00 the restaurant appeared to have been open for awhile because it was full and many people were waiting to be seated; again, inaccurate! Another time we asked what the dress code was at the casino and were told that my husband had to wear a jacket. Not true, there were people there is sweat suits and shirts, no jackets. These are just a few examples of the incorrect info we received. None of this ruined our trip, but just beware: DO NOT RELY ON THE FRONT DESK FOR INFORMATION ABOUT THE CITY! The only one at the hotel that we could depend on for solid information was the door man, Kamara, who made the stay at this hotel most enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern hotel, very stylish and thoughtfully designed.”
Reviews.Author: nansari111
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Granados 83. The hotel is styled very well. The finish throughout is very well done. The room had a nice, modern feel and a good size bathroom with nice fixtures. The main room had a stylish leather chair and ottoman, making for a relaxing sit. The room had a balcony as well, overlooking a nice sitting area. The common areas of the hotel were very nice, with glass elevators with visible moving parts, providing for an interesting view up and down. The only real downside, and it was minor for me, is that noise from the hallway is quite audible in the room. Not from neighboring rooms but it seems sound travels quite easily around the door. Another slight downside was that the front desk was not especially helpful with recommendations. I wanted a good, traditional tapas restaurant in the Old Quarter. Two people on separate occaisions really had no idea and suggested only a trendy spot closer to the hotel. Overall, a very nice hotel at a very fair price. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “All round great relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: GEMS_11
Reviews.Content: A hotel with genuine antiquities within reach of a 22 month olds fingers would not be my usual choice, but every member of our young family was made to feel so welcome and we were so well looked after by the absolutely delightful staff that how could we not return. The facilities and services (breakfasts, rooms etc) are all excellent and the hotel is ideal for a spot of shopping, fine dining and beach day trips out of the city. One small plea to management would be that housekeeping provide irons for use in the rooms because timings of laundry services never work for families. We loved staying at this hotel, our Catalan friends loved visiting us there and we are all planning to use the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Courteous & Knowledgable”
Reviews.Author: Tangomikespe
Reviews.Content: I rented two rooms for 5 nights, one for my daughter and her husband who were in Salou for the Spanish open ballroom competition, and one for myself. We picked Granados because Fodors said it was ona quiet side steet. It was perfectly quiet, and within easy walking distance to everything except perhaps Park Guell. I paid in advance, the courteous folks at the registration desk found my reservation with no problem, spook good English and were very helpful with maps on how to navigate from the hotel, and neaby restaurants, cafes and Tapas Bars. The rooms were very clean and cozy.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: Falouga1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Granados hotel through recommendations from TripAdvisor and we were NOT disappointed. We travelled with friends, and the hotel is really contemporary, I LOVED the design.... The hotel is well located, for those who like to be around Las Ramblas than it is a beautiful 15 to 20min walk. Yet for shopping u can find all the store 5min walk on the diagonal avenue...The rooms are nice and clean, although I must add that the bed are kind of short but the staff is very welcoming and helpful... True there are some construction around but didn't bother us at all... Would defenetly go stay there AGAIn and actually just recopmmended to friend of our to go there...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel & great staff but be aware of temporary construction and back rooms”
Reviews.Author: VegasFellow
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. PROS- Modern and clean. The staff is great and the location is great for Barcelona. Close enough to the Las Ramblas area and around nice shops and restaurants. CONS- Be warned that as of October 2010 they are drilling a train tunnel about 70 feet from the front door. All front facing rooms are affected. Contact the hotel to find out when construction has ceased. Also, rear facing rooms overlook an elementary school playyard with lots of bouncing balls and plastic flutes till about 4PM. One last thing, this hotel does not offer dark curtains (they are netted cloth) so you cannot make the room dark. All light shines in day and night.

Reviews.Title: “Little hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: emilyw
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with husband, went with it due to price we found including breakfast and reviews on here. All reviews are pretty as it was, very stylish almost aloof. Room a decent size loved the shutters which really aided sleep. there was some noise from above and beside but not enough to cause a problem. Breakfast had a great range to eat and was the best start to the day before embarking on a lot of walking. I wsa slightly unerved by the security instructions given on checking in, I know barcelona is known for pick pockets but not sure if this was totally necessary. Also pool not really a pool but roof top bar a nice place to enjoy a drink before going out. Plenty of places local to grab a bite to eat and it a really nice safe area. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, convenient location, compact but efficient”
Reviews.Author: Allegra603
Reviews.Content: Nice property within a 10-15 minute walk of the main tourist area (Las Ramblas). Close to the Diagonal and Provencal metro stops in case you prefer to use the metro. There's a large street project going on near the hotel which closed the street in front of the property, but the work only happened during the 8am-10pm hours, so no issue with sleeping. Nice rooftop lounge, but the pool was not meant for swimming at all... it seemed no bigger than a hot tub (but it was unheated). Guestrooms were small but stylish. Beds were a little short for my 6'2" travel companion, but they were comfortable enough. The shower was great!

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel but needs more comforts”
Reviews.Author: sosno
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week during our vacation in Barcelona. First the positives. The hotel is quite well located on a quiet street. It is about a 10 minute walk to Passage de Gracia and about 20 minute walk to Placa Catalunya and La Ramblas. A metro station a block away. The staff is friendly and responsive and speak English pretty well for the most part. The cons. They advertise that they have an exercise facility and a pool . The exercise room was tiny with room for 2 bikes. The pool is the size of hot tub and is not heated. There is no business center but there is a computer available for use. The room has very modern decor but is missing what we thought were some important elements. There was no table or chair or lamps. There was a small couch but the room in our opinion need more furnishings. The room is on the tight side with no place to put luggage for 2 people.

Reviews.Title: “Wow Wow & Wow”
Reviews.Author: neveragain85
Reviews.Content: Hi, Well what can I say but WOW WOW WOW!! - Had read the reviews, and sometimes when they are that good, you are a bit sceptical, but they were all spot on. I travelled with five friends, and could not have been made to feel more welcome. We arrived quite late on the Thursday night, and check in was quick and efficient. I had informed them before hand that I was disabled, and not only did they allocate me a room on the ground floor, with a walk in shower and easy access EVERYTHING, they had arranged a wheelchair for me, which was ready and waiting. I had sent a few emails before I left, and they were also answered immediately!! If there are any downsides it would be the size of the bed - which we found to be small - but that was it!! The rooms are tastefully decorated with great extra touches, wine, chocs, lovely robes, slippers, and most importantly proper sized towels!!!! Breakfast was amazing, best scrambled eggs I have had in years!! - Service was fantastic and all the staff went out of their way to help you in any way they could. The hotel is situated in a residential street, although quite a walk from the Ramblas, still in the centre of things. I have been to Barca before, and stayed in a hotel right on the Ramblas - far too noisy for me, this hotel was lovely and quiet. Exceptionally clean and well kept, I would not only recommend this to anybody looking for a great place to stay, I hopefully will be going back very very soon

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend at Granados 83 Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anuta_86
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a memorable weekend at the hotel in Barcelona. The hotel has a perfect location, we were near the center but at the same time in very quiet area. The hotel staff is friendly and professional, the level of the service is very high. We were impressed by the dinner at the terrace of the hotel. Definitely we will recommend Granados 83 Hotel to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “A precious gemm in an excellent location - extremely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: missveiga
Reviews.Content: We spent three wonderful nights in this hotel to celebrate our engagement. We had book a standard room, but we were happy to find out that we were upgraded to a great suite (loft) with our private pool. The hotel also offered us a bottle of Cava. What else could we ask for. The room is fabulous: perfect decoration, clean and very comfortable. I loved the fact that the hangers were proper hangers and we can perfect unpack our clothes without having to struggle to put the hanger back in the closet... We also had a robe and sleepers, which I always consider as a special treat. The decoration of the halls is incredible with lots of antiques. We got a free ticket to visit the Egyptian museum, which I found quite interesting, specially if you never visited Egypt before. The hotel location is fabulous, we were very closed to La Pedrera and there are plenty of nice restaurants around. Breakfast is very well served, your eggs are cooked the style you want at the time you request them. There are a great variety of fruits, pastries and breads. We asked for recommendations and the hotel staff was extremely helpful. There is always a door attendant to open the door and greet you. We love this hotel. We will definitely stay at Granados when we go back to Barcelona. Do not doubt, book your room with Granados and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel but we both definitely caught bedbug there”
Reviews.Author: anonymoustraveller77
Reviews.Content: we loved the hotel - hip and stylish. we were disapointed with the bedbugs and especially by the staff´s lack of interest in our concerns when we were waking up with more and more bites every day!!. we would only recommend the hotel if the disinfected the place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: WalesCastle
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Granados 83 exceeded expectations and our stay there was extremely comfortable. Warehouse brick/boutique type interior with very comfortable rooms/ facilities made this hotel a very pleasant experience. Excellent restaurants and main thoroughfares into the old city within close proximity. Effective air conditiong in public areas and bedrooms. Good sized LCD TVs and rooom safes. Great staff, superb service. Roof terrace a bonus but pool more the size of a pond. Hotel bar, breakfast and room service tariffs expensive. Breakfasts can be purchased locally at a fraction of the cost. Some late night noise at weekends. - ask for a room at rear of hotel. Taxis efficient and reasonable prices. Highly recommended .

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, great location, quiet, but pools not up to much”
Reviews.Author: electro101
Reviews.Content: It's in a good street, parallel with and three or four away from P. D. Gracia. Granados one of the streets with a pedestrian centreway, hence bars and restaurants scattered all the way down to Gran Via. The room - macho: brown leather, exposed brick, hidden cupboards, bed a tad short for me (I'm 6'). An ok TV, with BBC and CNN. Nice shower, no bath. I had a balcony with good sun, but annoyingly it had lights that couldn't be switched off (they went off on their own at 2 a.m.), so my late night drinking was a spectacle for the surrounding residents. The view out the back isn't great - it backs onto blocks of flats and a basketball court. I was on the 6th floor and their wireless internet didn't reach. Instead they rented me an ethernet cable for 10 euros, after which it was free. That's rare, and was appreciated. So - take a cable and avoid the charge ... Extras, e.g. mini-bar, laundry, were as pricey as usual (5.80 for a little gin, 9.00 to wash a pair of jeans). Would I stay again? Perhaps. I'd certainly pick the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Just got back from 5 nights there - great...”
Reviews.Author: s1d972
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 5 nights there - great location for sight seeing though if you aren't too mobile may be too far out for you. For me I preferred being outside of main La Rambla area (probably mile and half). Some great bars and restaurants near by and tube lines not far. Highly recommend a visit to Tibidabo, great views over Barca and Mediterranean. Would stop here again if visiting Barca again though would ask for high up room as we were on 2nd floor and quite noisy in the night (binmen mainly)

Reviews.Title: “BEST VALUE IN BCN”
Reviews.Author: remoazul
Reviews.Content: Habitual visitors every Summer. Can't think of a better hotel to stay in such a wonderful city. Greatest staff, great rooms. Ideal location, near the center, but away from the hustle and bustle. Duplex rooms have semi-private sun-decks and pool. Awesome feature.......

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, great location, helpful staff and excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: Martin101090
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel for 3 nights, everything about the stay was first class. The location of the hotel meant everything was in easy walking distance, loads of restaurants to choose from, try the hamburger place just up from the hotel. Rooms were immaculate with toiletries supplied.. Breakfast was freshly made and set us up for the day. The staff were always friendly and eager to assist. The highlight of the trip was the rooftop bar and pool after a long day sightseeing relaxing there with a cool drink was a real pleasure. Hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel Nice Area”
Reviews.Author: toon1979
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very modern with a great bar and pool on the room, there are some lovely bars and place to eat around within walking distance. It's maybe a bit away from the main tourist areas but this was one of the reasons we chose it, food and drinks are expensive in the hotel but very reasonable out and about. A very pleasent stay would go back to this hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel, very quiet neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: ilove-europ
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at Granados. We loved the hotel and LOVED Barcelona. It is very trendy and modern. I liked the brick exposure in the rooms. Although the view out our window was bad because the building across has been demolished so it was an empty lot. We had a large room with a couch and desk. The wall would slide over to cover the TV and desk area. There also was electric blinds that would come down to make the room extra dark. The light switches were a little confusing and we still never really figured them out. If you turned the switch in the bathroom off it would sometimes turn all the lights off. It was a little weird. The bathroom was large also. The staff was great and very helpful with all of our questions. They helped me find tons of places when I asked. THere was a computer downstairs where you could use the internet for free. We didn't eat at the hotel so I can't comment on that. There's a great pastry place across the street and coffee place around the corner. The pool on the roof is small, but who really lays out while in Barcelona! There's a nice bar upstairs but it closes a few times through out the day. The only bad thing about the hotel location is that it's almost too quiet. We like a few bars near our hotel for late night stops. Also, the metro is a little walk, about 10 minutes. We were there in the summer and it was very humid so a 10 minute walk was alot. It looks like there is a metro near the hotel, but it's the line that only goes far distances or Plaza Cataluyna. Also, you could hear the elevator from our room and we weren't really that close to it. We could hear people leaving the upstairs bar late at night going down the elevator. There was a slider door to enter the wing of the hotel that would click since it was automatic and we could also hear that. We just wore earplugs on the nights that we needed sleep. It wasn't so bad that we complained about it but it did annoy us. Overall I would stay here again but I might check out another equivalent hotel closer to the metro. I would book in their chain of hotels again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Style and substance: excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Shiru
Reviews.Content: This is one of those rare cases where a hip, trendy design hotel is also comfortable and has well-trained, helpful staff. Common areas are architecturally beautiful - a modern refurbishment of an old building. Rooms are not very large but very well thought out. Decor is modern, with some exquisite classical/oriental sculptures that bring a very unique feel. Clean lines, plenty of high-quality wood and leather, mood lighting, good music at the push of a button and the right amount of storage space and in-room mirrors make it extremely welcoming, functional and cosy. Staff is really friendly and helpful; service excellent. By the same owner as Barcelona's Egyptian museum, your stay comes with a complimentary ticket to the museum. All in all, definitely worth trying and coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Design Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Knight-of-the-Night
Reviews.Content: Very nice little design boutique hotel. In a rather quite side street. The old centre can be reached within minutes on foot. Nice coffee places around the corner. Small but very elegant roof-top terrace with a small pool. Staff is very attentive and kind. The rooms are extremely clean and rather stylish. The hotel is partially decorated with Asian antiques. Although it is very stylish it has a very warm and personal atmosphere. Approx. 35 min. from the airport (ca. € 28.- by taxi).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel-Excellent location-Excellent Value!”
Reviews.Author: lavelle30
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a weekend at the beginning of June and I thoroughly recommend this hotel!
