First off, the location is great... a ten minute walk to both Passeig de Gracia and Diagonal, passing great restaurants and tapas bars along the way, will see you onto the main thoroughfares into town. A Metro stop about 5 mins to the hotel will see even those who hate walking kept happy. Also, I had requested a room with a balcony and was granted a corner room (511) with a view onto the residential square with a school and apartments behind the hotel. A good size double room, well appointed with Egyptian artefacts, chaise longue and a modern, clean bathroom. At 220 euro for the weekend, it was absolutely great value! I had also requested a half bottle of red wine with some local chocolates which were very good.. the perfect thing to sit out on your balcony for a little while watching Barcelona life go by before heading out for a night! Yes they don't provide irons, but honestly, that's about the only thing you could fault the room for and for us, it didn't matter in the slightest! The staff were helpful and faultlessly polite. (You couldn't say they'd go too far out of their way for you, but that seems to be the way with city hotels generally!) The only thing I would quibble is the breakfast, which at about 19 euro (and non-cooked) is too pricey for my liking, but you'd be mad to eat breakfast in a hotel when staying in a city like Barcelona. One recommendation I would make is a Tapas Bar called 'Catalunya' on the corner of Calle Mallorca and Calle Catalunya... this is a real find if you're into your fresh food! Overall, we had a great experience in this hotel and would highly recommend it for a visit to the city!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but claustrophobic room & underground parking”
Reviews.Author: mikehofer
Reviews.Content: I have been in Barcelona for both business and holidays on numerous occasions, but I never had such a small room. I was in a small single room, barely larger than the bed, with a window to the inside of the building. No noise, but no daylight either, which I found quite annoying, especially because the rest of the hotel was rather nice. Staff was very helpful in finding a nice restaurant, guided me while parking the car in level -3 which was so narrow and steep that it was a matter of centimeters and multiple tries. Also, the roof terrace was small, but equipped with a nice bar & keeper. Will probably go there again, but ask for a room with daylight...

Reviews.Title: “All form, very little substance.”
Reviews.Author: Aristoseimi
Reviews.Content: I've spent a lot of time in Barcelona lately for business... I tried the Granados 83 this time because of it's excellent location in Eixample. The hotel itself it architecturally stunning on the inside, the rooms are comfortable (even with the Spanish queen-sized bed, i.e., two twins shoved together... although I've found this precarious and uncomfortable arrangement to be common in all parts of Spain), the balcony was a pleasant surprise, and the pool area looked enjoyable (although I had no time to avail myself of it). I arrived from the US early on a Tuesday morning, and didn't actually check in until later that night (I had to go to my office after I dropped off my bags). When I finally did check in, I asked for an iron so that I could get some of the wrinkles out of my work clothes for the next day -- I was told that they possessed no such thing as an iron, and that all laundry was sent out: the best they could do was have a suit pressed for me the NEXT AFTERNOON. I went to work a little wrinkly the next day, and decided to have all my laundry pressed during the day - it wasn't brought back to me until 11pm. I really try to recognize that my perspective in an American one, and that Spain moves with less urgency, but really, the ironing situation was really just not good enough. As for the internet situation at the Granados, it's unacceptable - the wifi simply didn't exist in my room (although I did have a signal near the elevators, closer to the center of the hotel), and the wired connection just plain didn't work. The "gym" was the size of a closet, and contained an uncomfortable stair-stepper and a bike... still, better than nothing. Otherwise, I found most of the staff a little rude (again, compared to the staff at other hotels in Barcelona), and the bar areas always seemed to be closed. I recommend this hotel, but only because of its location, and only if you get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for a great city!”
Reviews.Author: stevieb1975
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner for 4 nighta just arriving back to the UK yesterday. All in all we had a fantastic time. The hotel itself is a boutique style design hotel with great decor throughout, the staff were really friendly and helpful though also thoroughly unobtrusive...which I feel is a great balance. Our room, on the 6th floor, was a good size and beautifully appointed and there's mood settings for the lights to give you the ambience you want. The bathroom is similarly well appointed. The wardrobe was ok in size - though if you were staying for more than a few days with a partner you may be pressed for storage if you've got lots of clothes. The bed was very comfortable and really wide so big plus there..and when we arrived there was a lovely red rose in a vase on the bed side table The website states that there are patios / terraces to the rooms - my room certainly didn't have one and I couldn't see any evidence of them to the front of the hotel - though there may have been some at the back of the hotel. The website also states that the rooms have a music system and dvd....if you think this means a separate music system then you'll be disappointed - you can buy a 'cd' played through the tv for 24hours for 5 euros and there's an eclectic selection. No separate dvd although again you can get movies through the tv - but then that's pretty standard in hotels of course. In terms of location - for us it was perfect - about 10 mins brisk walk to Pl. Catalunya, there's a Metro station just a couple of mins walk away and a supermarket by the metro station to get water, munchies etc. All in all a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly impressive”
Reviews.Author: ajsbabe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in March and were very happy with the selection. They were running an online special so we received 30% off the room rate-I think we paid about 100Euro/night. The location is really great and the room was very nice, comfortable and much larger than some of the other rooms we've seen in Europe. Overall, it was very comparable to many American hotels. The TV has 5 or 6 english stations. We had requested a higher floor room due to potential noise and this request was accomodated. The only little gripe we had is that in Spain, it's prohibited to run the air before a certain date and the heater was set a little too high for us. We were able to open the window(but noisy). It'd be great if they kept the hotel heat a little lower and then we could have turned up our room heat if necessary, but this wasn't really that much of an inconvenience. We paid extra for the breakfast which we thought was worth it given the big variety of pretty good foods, although were a little disappointed with the breakfast service we received from the female waitress who we had to walk over to so that we could even place our order. We didn't eat at the restaurant(lunch/dinner) until our last day which was a mistake because we both found the food to be wonderful and the price for their meals of the day(with several choices) was very reasonable. Although we didn't get drinks up there, they have a pretty cool roof top bar with a view and a plunge pool as well. There is also a computer with free internet access with was awesome. We found the front desk service to be great and they were very helpful in providing directions, ideas where to go to purchase things we were looking for and they also called to make several dinner reservations for us. We would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “UNSCRUPULOUS HOTEL! DO NOT STAY HERE! AWFUL! AWFUL! AWFUL!”
Reviews.Author: angel_valentine
Reviews.Content: This hotel has one of the worst hotel management of any property I have ever stayed at. They cancelled our reservation and did a bait and switch on us TWO HOURS BEFORE WE WERE TO CHECK IN. If you read the other reviews below, you'll see that this particular hotel has done this to other patrons as well. SHAME ON THEM! Unbeknownst to us, we had a reservation at this hotel during Mobile Telecom Week in Barcelona. All of the hotels in the city were fully committed, however since we booked far in advance, we received a discounted rate for our room. We were staying at another hotel in Barcelona prior to checking to this hotel. My husband called the Granados prior to check in to inquire whether we could request early check-in because I was pregnant and feeling very ill that day. The front desk said they were working on check-outs and would call us if they could accommodate us earlier. Thirty minutes later, just as we were walking over to the Granados from our prior hotel, the front desk called us and told us that they are transferring us to a "sister" hotel. That's it! They did not ask us if it was okay with us, offered any explanation, or gave us any alternatives. When we asked why, and they gave us some nebulous answer that there was some "technical difficulties" with one of their floors and so they have a shortage of rooms. When pressed about what these technical difficulties were and how many rooms were lost, they declined to answer. We told them that we didn't believe them because they would have told us about such a catastropic technical difficulty which took away several of their rooms when we called 30 minutes earlier. They had nothing to say to that either. We were so mad, especially upon checking into their sister "five star" hotel. It was old and dated, among many other problems. Definitely NOT even three stars! We were promptly given two twin beds, even though we requested a king/queen. We called the Granados back and demanded to speak to the manager. This is the worst part of all: THE HOTEL MANAGER OF THE GRANADOS NEVER TO THIS DAY EVEN GAVE US THE COURTESY OF CALLING US BACK TO HEAR OUR GRIEVANCES. An hour or two later, they merely had room service send up a bottle of cava to "make up" for our troubles. At this point, I was so sick that I could only lie in bed. So, my husband decided for my sake to just accept the circumstances. The next day, the sister hotel offered to "upgrade" us to a junior suite, but, believe me, it was not much of an upgrade. An even more outdated room with more square footage. Again, we never ever heard from the management at Granados. I THINK THE GRANADOS 83 IS A DESPICABLE PLACE AND I WOULD NEVER GIVE MY RECOMMENDATION FOR ANYONE TO STAY HERE. It's a shame because we otherwise had a fabulous "baby-moon" in Barcelona. It's a vibrant and beautiful city and the people there are so nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, funky, comfortable hotel in a safe and friendly area of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Daffodil_NI
Reviews.Content: Granados 83 proved to be an excellent base to see the sights of Barcelona. The hotel itself is within waking distance to Provenca / diagonal train stop, which made getting around the city v.easy, or if you were feeling energetic a 15-20min walk would take you to Las Ramblas. We found the area to be a v.safe area with many great restaurants/bars to choose from in the evenings. On arrival we were upgraded to a room with a balcony which was excellent. The staff were friendly, helpful and the extra touches e.g. bath robes, slippers, candy canes on the beds etc made for a very enjoyable stay. THOROUGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing too much trouble”
Reviews.Author: BB_Brighton
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel, friendly and helpful staff - nothing was too much trouble. Very gay friendly and in a great location for night-life. Not cheap, but then this is Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel close to 2 Gaudi sights and a Martini Bar”
Reviews.Author: pesote
Reviews.Content: This hotel is modern and well designed. It is close to La Pedrera, Casa Battlo and the Michelin star restaurant Moo in Omm hotel. Around the corner is a Martini bar. The hotel is very clean, e.g. the glass of the hotel entrance door was so clean that I banged my head against it the first day. Rooftop terraces looked fine - though it was December.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and decent value.....”
Reviews.Author: Caveman1978
Reviews.Content: Was worried that the hotel would be too far out of town but it's actually very well located to the north of the main attractions. The transport system in Barcelona is really impressive and we purchased 2 T-10 tickets which got us from the airport, into Barcelona and around the city for our three night stay; bargain at just over 7 Euros each. The hotel itself is very nice, rather trendy but well laid out and the staff were helpful when asked. Other people have written about the air conditioning and it's a bit of a pain intially. When the air-con is on, the room is cooled as you want it. If, however, you turn it off (ask reception) and you use the shower, the room quickly turns into a sauna! Just call reception and they'll sort it out for you though. Bar on the roof is cosy and firendly. The rooftop swimming pool is very small. Personally didn't eat at the hotel, although the menu looked very good; main reason being that it was empty as we tended to want to eat before the locals i.e. before eight in the evening. There are a number of very good places to eat nearby though. Buffet breakfast was great, although if it's not included in your tarrif, I'm not sure I would pay the 15 Euros or so for it. We got it included in our 100 Euro/night package for a front facing double bedroom on the fourth floor. All in all, a great place to stay. Clean and friendly and well positioned for exploring the city. Barcelona is a great place!

Reviews.Title: “a very nice return visit”
Reviews.Author: divenuts
Reviews.Content: once again i really enjoyed the grandos 83. it's nice to return to a hotel after a couple of years absence and not be disappointed. this time we had a duplex room which was spacious, nicely furnished, stylish, comfortable (although the same sq. footage on one floor would be more practical). it's reasonably priced, especially for a big city european hotel and our weak u.s. dollars, in new york this hotel would cost at least 50% more. the hotel staff is friendly and helpful, the breakfast is nice. the hotel is within reasonable walking distance (unless you're in a hurry, or lazy) of las ramblas, picasso museum, gothic quarter, sagrada familia and other tourist sites, as well as good restaurants such as bar inopia, cervaceria catalunya, cinc sentis and those in the born, la bouqueria market and gothic quarters. the only bad (and small) rooms at this hotel are those with an interior view, avoid them.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely clean hotel with very helpful and courteous staff.”
Reviews.Author: Torshammer
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel was a pearl in Barcelona. Although it is not right by Las Ramblas it is not that far. A 15 minute walk and you are in an area where there is quiet bliss. The rooms were large enough and clean and stylish. The air conditioning was a bit difficult to program to our wishes. The staff were very helpful and all tried to speak English . Breakfast outside was absolutely devine and the staff serving breakfast was great. After a couple of days they even remembered our special needs without us asking for it. I can't find anything to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: GCE3
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Modern and beautiful. Staff is professional and helpful. Would stay again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Classy boutique hotel, very nice.”
Reviews.Author: KeefM
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, with trendy decor and friendly, helpful staff. Although in the centre of the city, not actually that close to the more famous sites. I would definately use the roof top bar, snazzy!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: happy-girl090
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel following previous recommendations. The hotel was really cool, although if your scared of heights the glass lift to the top floor was a little scary! The staff were really friendly and helpful and the room was immaculate. The rooftop pool was a great place to cool off tired feet at the end of day, but it is small so don't expect to swim lengths! The area the hotel is in was really nice, with some great local bars and restaurants near by. The main hub of Barcelona is a 20min walk or a super speedy metro journey (we bought a metro ticket valid for 10 journeys which was worthwhile). I would definately stay here again, we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but not very central”
Reviews.Author: Dublin1Eire
Reviews.Content: Quiet nice hotel, room was very spacious and decorated really well. Staff were helpful. Altough the room was very dark and didn't get any natural light - the window faced out into an internal courtyard. Our room was on the ground floor beside reception and we could hear there conversations word for word - request a room on the first floor upwards. Nice roof terrace, althoughvery small. 20 mins walk to Passeig de Gracia, then a further 20 mins to Las Ramblas. Very small bar area which only opens for a couple of hours at night. A hotel which might be better suited to business clients rather than tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel, but A LITTLE too far from centre”
Reviews.Author: AllanBLondon
Reviews.Content: Hotel: Pros - Unusual, very modern, fantastic public areas including small rooftop pool. Beautiful room, gorgeous bathroom. 5 star touches such as bathrobes, big fluffy towels. Cons. Room a bit small but it was fine. Room service was VERY expensive Location: Pros - nice area, very close to some of the main Gaudi sights and the main (posh) shopping streets. Lots of lovely cafes etc which are excellent value on the doorstep. Beside gay area, Cons: Quite far from the Gothic area, which is a tube ride away. Service: nothing wrong but nothing special. Value: excellent. Conclusion: very nice hotel in nice area. However if its your first time in Barcelona you may prefer to stay in the Old Town. If you have the money, the Neri is the place.

Reviews.Title: “A bit too trendy for us - but amazing all the same”
Reviews.Author: Hugh M
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, fantastic cocktail bar, great breakfasts (both in-room or downstairs) pretty good location with a couple of nice (local) tapas bars on the same street. We had an amazing time, and would recommend. But honestly - it was just a wee bit too uber-trendy for us. There's a little bit of a 'dress all in black' thing going on with all the staff, and the other guests were generally a bit more fashionable and beautiful than us. It wasn't quite enough to make us feel uncomfortable, but it was close.... Again - amazing hotel, would recommend, but just be aware it's quite 'cool'.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel to explore the city from.”
Reviews.Author: alltheworld2c
Reviews.Content: This was tough to rate. I wanted to give this hotel a five star rating, but the room is small and the room-cleaning staff did a mediocre job two of the three nights we stayed there. Otherwise, we were very pleased. The restaurant staff and the front reception staff were all engaging and helpful. The location is only a block from a metro station so all of Barcelona is very close, yet this hotel is in the Eixample area and thus quieter than being in the main tourist/historic area, but still only about six blocks away. The restaurant was excellent with a large selection for continental breakfast and optional hot dishes besides. Lunch was also superb. We ate a very, very expensive anniversary celebrating dinner at ABaC Restaurant (highly acclaimed, one star Michelin rating) which was abysmal. I wished we had eaten at the hotel instead. I give a very hearty recommendation for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb, welcoming hotel in great area for relaxing and sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: NeilwTurner
Reviews.Content: Very well appointed hotel with excellent staff. The front desk spoke excellent English and were very helpful ... and this level of service extended to the dining room and bars. The bedroom was excellent, great shower, great king size bed and nicely fitted and laid out room. Hotel is well positioned about 10 mins north of Pl Catalunya along La Rambla ... ideal for sightseeing yet away from noise and hassle. Plenty of very good restaurants in the area with all types of food. Would willingly stay there again ... great hotel in a very exciting, vibrant city with so much to do and see

Reviews.Title: “Granados 83 offers a good location, good service, and good price.”
Reviews.Author: Eileen R
Reviews.Content: After booking the Hotel 1898 on the Rambla for considerably more money, we switched to Granados 83 when we discovered their much better price (about 100 euros a night plus tax, including a 15% discount for 4 or more days). The hotel is in the Exiample business district on a quiet street about 4 blocks from the upper Rambla (which is much classier than the tourist area), and only 2 blocks from 2 metro stops. Formerly a birthing center, Granados 83 (its name is its address) is ultra modern with exposed brick walls and glass hallways. The staff was very helpful and, unlike most of Barcelona, actually spoke English! Our room was not huge, but clean and efficient with all the amenities, including a "rain" shower, enormous towels and robes, and a wakeup call built into the TV. Restaurants in the area abound. The hotel's breakfast is way too expensive at 18 euros, but there are numerous outside alternatives and the staff was happy to point them out. Ask for Hugo at the front desk: he gave us exceptional service.

Reviews.Title: “the staff combined with the overall package exceed my expectations”
Reviews.Author: chmod
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Granados, and though we expected a fine stay we were very impressed by the staff in particular. Everyone was friendly, all spoke enough English to make us feel welcome, and the facility provided all the amenities we desired. Free, unlimited WIRED Internet (how many places offer feeble, spotty and dog slow "wireless" Internet?) Beautiful and well designed layout. Fabulous rooftop bar. I realize this is subjective, but in fairness and excluding the design if you do not appreciate it, the place is impeccably clean. Powerful shower, large bathrobes, climate control you can actually manipulate, and dead silent. We loved it. The buffet breakfast was convenient for us, and as you can get expresso and scrambled eggs on demand, in addition to the large buffet, met our needs completely. We also liked the neighborhood. Great local restaurants, removed from the chaos of the Ramblas, we found our proximity to things to be well suited for a quiet stay. Highly recommended, but study the web site and photos carefully. If you prefer the blandness and conformity of traditional hotel chains, stay the heck away. This is for people who are alive and willing to use all of their senses!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect romantic hideaway”
Reviews.Author: incredible2
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were greeted by the doorman and our cases took straight to our rooms after a speedy check in. Staff were all very friendly and helpful, we could not fault anything about the hotel. Beds turned down in the evening and everything about the room was well layed out. Bathrooms were impeccable and fresh towels every day. We didn't eat there but mainly because of euro and expense, but we found an excellent tapas bar/restaurant around the corner where you had a little wait to get a table but you can drink and people watch as the buzz is certainly evident and entertaining. It was a bit of a walk to get to the Rambla's but you have plenty of shops en route and choices of bars. We took the bus from the airport, then from reading other reviews we got a cab from playa de catalyuna which was the most sensible. Hotel is well situated for everything, get a metro ticket for 10 trips anywhere in the city. The metro was easy enough to negotiate.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: johnno44
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful. Booked this as a little getaway. The suite we had was amazing, dulplex suite, two bathrooms, living room downstairs with bedroomn upstairs and a terrace with a lap pool (although lap pool not wide enough to actually swim properly). Excellent air con. Roof pool tiny but a great vibe on an evening. Hotel staff extremely friendly, food great. The hotel is slightly away from the hussle and bussle of La Ramblas but with easy walking distance. If you can, go !

Reviews.Title: “Great 4* value”
Reviews.Author: BrittainBoy
Reviews.Content: Picked Granados 83 for a 4 day pre-Xmas break. It is an excellent 4* hotel in a genuinely quiet location (semi-pedestrian street, no traffic noise) just 3 blocks from La Pedrera. Very well trained and helpful staff were a particular plus point. The rooms are well described on the Hotel website (look there for full details & pics) , but I'd summarize it as "Design" styling, but with enough wood and leather to avoid being cold. Absolutely spotlessly clean, with a huge and powerful shower (no bath - at least in rm 511). Plus a few antiques spread about to break up the shiny surfaces. Good breakfast buffet + a la carte eggs/bacon etc. available - but check whether it is included in your rate. Only one minor niggle - the heating/ac was slightly noisier than ideal. But Barcelona was such a lovely temperature in Dec that we just turned it off anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great style and service”
Reviews.Author: mrsscottydog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Granados 83 in October 2008. After searching many sites and reviews we agreed on the Granados due to its location and design qualities. I checked the booking before we arrived and the receptionist was very polite and friendly. When we arrived we had a similar greeting and were impressed by the look and feel of the hotel. We were given one of the disabled rooms on the ground floor which although very nice felt a bit claustrophobic with a view onto the inner coutyard which was not private. We had booked a city view room. We went back to reception and were told that they were fully booked. They offered us a free upgrade to a superior room for our second night which we accepted. Later that night we received an apology from the manager with free bubbly and strawberries! Our new room was actually smaller but had a balcony at the back of the hotel with a view onto backs of apartments. Saying this, we did enjoy our stay and would recommend Granados 83. The staff were friendly and professional, the rooms were more than adequate and the general design and ambiance beautiful. Make sure you get what you have booked though and dont let them fob you off with something else!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - you just need earplugs”
Reviews.Author: JCLON
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via Expedia as they had a very good rate. It is a very nice hotel, great design, very comfortable cozy rooms. Most of the rooms have brick wall views as they overlook a light well. Since I was there in business I did not really mind – plus it is usually bad news to have a room on a busy street in Spain as it tends to be noisy until late. Unfortunately, the room was not so quiet, as the Air Conditioning unit made a humming noise all night. It was not even mine; the noise was coming from the hallway. I checked in other hallways on other floors and the humming noise was there as well. I used earplugs which took care of the problem, so all in all, not too bad an experience. I recommend this hotel for the design and its location as long as you have earplugs handy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Designer Hotel”
Reviews.Author: St-Lucia_Enthusiast
Reviews.Content: This is a great designer hotel. Having read some of the previous reviews I was a bit worried about noise etc but it was not a problem. This was a special treat so I booked a duplex room, which has a bedroom upstairs with shower room and wc and a living room downstairs with bath, shower, wc. Off the bedroom there was outside steps leading up to a sectioned off roof terrace with a long narrow "pool". So, two wardrobes, 2 showers, 4 bathrobes, endless fluffy towels plus two pool towels and 2 minibars and LCD Tvs! On our first night we came back from a restaurant to find that we had been given a complimentary bottle of Cava. Even the glasses (by Schott) were designer. A nice touch. Pluses As mentioned by other reviewers, the staff at the Grenados are really nice and genuinely interested in people having a good time. They were very helpful answering my questions and recommending hotels. They were professional, unobstrusive and a real asset. The Housekeeping was outstanding. Our room was checked 3x a day and any used towels replaced. They were also very generious with the toileteries. The bedroom had a comfortable bed and the blackout blinds were really effective. It was very quiet. The lighting and lit antiquities in the corners all added to the atmosphere. We had the "fried eggs" on the pillow bit too which was a bit strange........ The rather funky music and music system took a bit of getting used too, imagine trance and club chill music and this should give you some idea! By the 3rd night I was looking forward to some of the tracks however! The pool terrace bar upstairs and the atmosphere both at 7:30 in the evening and when we came back after going to a restaurant, was chilled. Other guests seemed to meet up there too and the cocktails, particularly the mojitos were lovely if very strong! We were there until 1am on two nights (the official closing time is 2am). The semi-private pool was nice but is really a strip of water that runs along the terrace and you can't really swim in it. It was also cold but we are used to this! Having our own sunloungers, table and umbrella on the terrace was a plus. We had breakfast at the hotel once on the day we checked out and it was good. We ate in the restaurant the first night and the food was modern Mediterranean My husband had a tuna tartare with wasabi sorbet which was exceptional. Again the lighting and design of the restaurant and outside eating area all added to the experience. Minuses The cocktails were on the pricey side as was the restaurant but the quality was good. The downstairs shower flooded the floor, the bath has a channel running around it which fills up with water when the shower is on and floods the floor. The view from the semi-private terrace was uninspiring, and, if you book the duplex rooms leading from the ground floor( we had 206) you are a bit overlooked from the balconies above. I understand that there are duplex rooms on the 5th/6th floor but you may get more noise from the bar there. Finally, the steps in the connecting rooms are all in orange marble and the floors are wood, with the low lighting it would have been easy to miss one. There is a railing going down from the bedroom to the hall area but not to the sitting room. Because of the above I give the hotel 4/5 but I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Design hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: Swedish_Traveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a peaceful area with beautiful other buildings around. There are nice cafees around and its close to the more busier avenues. Its a boutique hotel with a stunning modern design. Everything yes eveything has an interesting design and there are beautiful art pieces in the room. The bathroom was very futuristic in the design as you can see. No problems with the staff and room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch design, great service, but beware the single rooms.”
Reviews.Author: mrglobal
Reviews.Content: THE GOOD: Unlike many "design hotels," this one looks every bit as good in person as in photos. Though small, the rooms are really chic (though perhaps too masculine for some women's taste). The designers did not scrimp on materials, and it shows. Beautiful wood and wood veneer throughout. Leather and marble also used in large quantities. Great black-out shutters, too. The entire staff was extremely friendly and professional. The location is also very desireable, close to the tourist center, but not directly in it, a two block walk from the less-toursity part of Las Ramblas (Rambla de Catalunya) and a similar number of blocks from the Metro. THE BAD: The closet is a tight fit, but the real complaint (as in most "boutique hotels") is the noise. A good-looking hotel is great, but if you can't sleep, what's the point? In fact, I'm growing so exasperated with this problem that I'm ready to go back to the Holiday Inn! Halls are covered in hard, noise-echoing surfaces, which serve to amplify the sounds of slamming doors and housekeepers rustling trash bags. I don't remember ever having trouble sleeping at a hotel (when not under construction) until the boutique trend started. Soon I'll get over being a slave to design... THE UGLY: I booked a "single room" since I was traveling alone. A double bed was specified at the time of booking, so nothing seemed suspicious and I assumed this referred to the number of travelers. Wrong! Imagine my surprise when taken to my room only to find that it had no outside exposure! It was really tiny (okay, I can live with that), but I could not accept that the window looked into the indoor lobby atrium. No sunlight, no air, nada! And what really galled me is that when I went to ask for a different room, the otherwise pleasant clerk breezily told me that all single rooms have "windows onto the patio." As if I should have known better than to expect a window to the OUTSIDE. First of all, it isn't a "patio" if there's a solid roof over it (not even glass). The clerk tried to convince me that what I didn't have was a "view." I explained that what I didn't have was a window, even if the view was only of an airshaft. The solution? You guessed it... I paid 30 euro a night extra to upgrade to a "double room" which was only slightly larger, had the same-sized bed, but had an actual window. This disingenousness on the part of the hotel marketers--and the training they've given the staff on how to respond to the resulting complaints--cast a shadow over what would otherwise have been a mostly-pleasant stay. The hotel group needs to be honest with customers at the time of booking, and let them decide whether or not they can live without exposure to the outside world. Otherwise, they are employing bait-and-switch tactics which are unethical.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, sexy and modern”
Reviews.Author: Petrushka3
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Granados on business rather than pleasure and obviously this puts a different perspective on my stay. The most obvious thing to say is simply that the hotel is extremely chic and classy, with some stunning art work throughout. Check-in was friendly and effecient and although my room wasn't ready on arrival, the staff were very quick to sit me in the small bar with a complimentary drink. Communal spaces are a little limited, but I actually rather liked that - may have felt differently if this had been a holiday though. The high quality finishes and style followed through to my room which whilst a little small, was more than adequate for me. Really nicely decorated with quality fixtures and fittings. The view at the back of the hotel isn't that exciting! But what would you expect from an inner city hotel. The restaurant and room service was excellent and whilst it was a little expensive, it was certainly not ridiculous. The staff were superb, friendly and helpful - which in some ways is even more important when you are on your own without family! I must admit, I didn't see as much of the city as I'd have liked due to work, but certainly the hotel is well positioned for the main shopping areas. I think this is a superb hotel for business trips or for weekend breaks. It didn't seem the sort of place for children or families (a plus if I'm honest). I do think I'd want something a little more substantial if I was staying for more than a couple of days and with my wife - but I would have no reservations in recommending the Granados. Overall, it looks fantastic, the service is great and the hotel feels high quality throughout.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Experience”
Reviews.Author: hokuhoshi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed three nights at Granados 83. Our room was small, but very well designed and modern. Our view, as other reviewers had stated, was of an empty lot across the street. Pool and gym are tiny. Free internet access, but you do need to rent a cable from the hotel. The staff were excellent, helpful and friendly. Housekeeping too. Our only issue - smoke permeating our room. Room was supposedly smoke-free, but we think it may have come through the vents from the restaurants and bars throughout the hotel. I'm pretty sensitive to smoke, so ended up with congestion in my lungs that pretty much lasted throughout our two-week trip. We loved the wonderful restaurants and neighborhood of the Eixample surrounding Granados 83. We'd most likely stay in the same area, but different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish in a nice part of town”
Reviews.Author: DrCorona
Reviews.Content: Positive: -Great value -Good location (I really liked the neighborhood, lots of bars and restaurants) -Stylish -Staff was very polite and helpful -Clean Negative: -View from the room was pretty much a demolished building -Room were not very big (had the standard twin) -The sound-proofing need improvment, its was as the door didnt exist some times, especially when the cleaning started in the mornings. (This is what made the ranking 4/5 instead of 5/5)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and edgy decor”
Reviews.Author: Wandering20082008
Reviews.Content: This modern Design Hotel is filled with ancient sculpture and is a wonderful oasis when the Barcelona scene gets to be too much. The bed is huge and comfy with soft pillows and quality bed linens. There is free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Verdict: spectacular”
Reviews.Author: TotallyBushed
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Barcelona and a 2 night stay at Grandos 83. First thing to say is that this hotel will not dissapoint if you are looking for a modern, quiet and incredibly stylish boutique hotel in Barcelona. There are delightful design touches throughout this hotel which melds stark modernism with Far/Midlle East antique art pieces. The room I had 201, had a king size bed with a decent size bathroom. All fixtures and fittings work well with the interior and are of a high standard. And the rooftop bar and pool are delightful. The beautiful thing is that the hotel is quiet and so the very small pool was never crowded. The mojitos and caipirinhas were of Spanish quality (i,e strong!) and the staff friendly. Even giving us free drinks at one point. At night this space is special especially with the recent full moon and quiet neighbourhood. The staff were friendly and multilingual and seeemed rightly impressed with their hotel. The only downsides I can think of is that it's 5 euros to play any music from the media TV thingy. Plus for some the location is too far from the action i.e. 10 min walk to the top of La Ramblas. I went for a romantic weekend (I'm 30) and it was right on the money. It's close to the metro stop Diagonal/ Provenca. L'Eixample is close to many Gaudi buildings too. Day trips arund are easy and thought of schmoozing in the pool plus mojito, then back to the darkly lit romantic room made us see less of the city than envisaged. This is no bad thing. Trust me. All in all highly recommeded.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: AOkoro
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Feb 2007 for two nights. After having been holed up in a putrid dive passing itself off as a three-star hotel in Madrid, this couldn't have been more of a contrast. Superb, boutique hotel, great rooms (shame about the lack of windows though), top-notch bar. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcgorr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveiently placed for shopping near the Rambla, a 10 minute walk away, although difficult to get to other than walking or a taxi. I booked thru the website, 123 euros room only. It was excellent in every way; the room was very,very spacious with great lighting systems, robes, slippers and toiletries. It had a leather sofa, wooden floors, plasma TV and as I said a brilliant lighting system. Staff was excellent, hekpful and accommodating. I didn't eat in the hotel. I will certainly return. Ate in a nearby restaurant with superb good at reasonable prices, there seemed to be lots nearby.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Its_Scandinavian
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice design hotel with a good location close to the old and the new part of Barcelona. It's not a five star property but a good four star property. We really loved the breakfast with small mozarella cheese and fresh fruit in a nice atmosphere. Our room had a small balcony we really enjoyed. Special benefits/amenities such as a red rose, complimentary early morning espresso and a evening juice made the stay even more enjoyable. There was not a bathtub in the clean white bathroom but the shower was great. The ambiance in the roof top bar and in the restaurant was very slow, but only because the missing of other people. I really like the design with water falls and sinks allover. A great stay and a nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Eixample Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FloridaTravelmum
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Granados 83, so we definitely liked it well enough to return. Location is hard to beat. Right in the middle of the Eixample area with lots of dining options in walking distance. While rooms are small, they are so well laid out that you don't even notice. They have a restful color scheme with lots of dark wood, the obligatory flat screen tv on the wall but behind a sliding panel. The bathroom was stark white with all the modern trappings and nice amenities all kitted out in a little zippered case, presumably to just slip in your 1 quart, see through, zip lock bag for airplane travel. Staff was helpful with dining reservations and recommended the Windsor, where we had the best (non tapas) meal of our trip. We've never eaten in the hotel's own restaurant, except for breakfast, which is lovely but a bit pricey, but the space is certainly pleasing. All in all, we could find nothing to quibble about with this place and a great deal to like, especially the value when you book one of the rooms for an off-season February visit. BTW Barcelona is a terrific European destination at that time of year with temps in the high 50s and even 60s permitting lunchtime outdoor dining.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: brazilianwanderlust
Reviews.Content: When my wife and I stayed here in early May, 2006, the hotel had just inaugurated, and a small part of it was still under construction. I had never stayed in a brand new hotel before, and it was fun. But I wonder what the hotel feels like these days, after it has found its feel. It is a very charming hotel, in a very nice area of Barcelona. The only thing that I could complain about was that the room was a bit small, but maybe in comparison to the hotel in Madrid I'd just left a few days before. Anyway, Spain is a great country, and Barcelona is one of those places where you could easily live.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Teme
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at Granados 83 in early November. Over all a great experience. Liked especially the design - dark surfaces, wood and leather, use a rough metal etc. We had a room on 6th floor. A nice little balcony facing the inner yard. Room was adequate in size, nice bathroom as well. The hotel corridors have wooden floors and it really was quite noisy from time to time. We had a loft sensation package and the breakfast was included. The buffet was generous, served in a calm enviroment. Very nice start for the day. Hotel staff was helpful. The room was cleaned twice a day. Location is good, a few blocks away from the main shopping street Passaig de Gracia. Lots of restaurants and bars nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Your reservation may be worthless!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Northcutts
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks great and it is in a great area, but be warned that they might sell your room right out from under you!!! We booked 4 rooms for a major trade show to be held in February 2008, paid a deposit, got confirmations from the major online booking company we used. I sent a follow up email directly to the hotel to confirm the reservation and got no reply. About a week or two later I got a call from the online booking company to tell me that this hotel did not have our rooms (to their credit they helped us find another hotel and did offer some compensation for our inconvenience). Upon further conversation it came out that the Granados 83 most likely did have the rooms at the time we booked, but decided that they could get more money for the rooms and so gave ours to someone else. BAD BUSINESS. Like I said, it may be a nice place, but if you are going to stay here, keep watch on your reservations!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Snaffs
Reviews.Content: Unlike many other hotels I have stayed in, this one looks exactly like the pictures on their website. The decor is well designed and high quality fittings have been used. The location is in easy access to the main areas yet far enough away to avoid the traffic noise. We had requested a smoking room when we booked on Lastminute.com however upon arrival we found out that the whole hotel is non smoking. The desk staff were extremely helpful and offered us the option of having a non smoking room or they would do us a good price to upgrade to a suite. We were shown both rooms and immediately took the suite. We had room 607 which has a small balcony outside the bedroom, a mezannine floor with sofa, tv etc and opens onto a lovely terrace. The terrace is shared between 4 or 5 rooms (although we did not see anybody else out there during our 3 night stay) and has a swimming pool running along the length of it. Whilst the pool was too cold to use suring late October it was a lovely feature and made the terrace very relaxing. I can imagine during a hot summer this would be lovely for a dip after a long day walking around the city. All the staff in the hotel were very friendly and helpful and all spoke good English. I cannot comment on the food as we ate outside the hotel. The breakfast is rather expensive at 16 Euros and there are plently of places nearby to get a coffee and some breakfast and sit outside and watch the world go by. If you need to get a taxi from the hotel I would recommend hailing one in the street, as if you book one by phone a charge of about 6 Euros is added to your fare before you have gone anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Find”
Reviews.Author: GeeBee200
Reviews.Content: Personally i hate the huge, impersonal Hilton-esqu hotels, where you feel you are merely a hotel room number, hence i generally try and stay in smaller chains or singular hotels. My stay at Granados confirmed my thoughts - it's a lovely little hotel (77 rooms) in the middle of Barcelona. The team were great - they were all so helpful and friendly and really seemed to care if you were enjoying your stay. Our room was on the small side, but it was perfectly adequate and i'm sure that they would have moved us if we could have been bothered. The air conditioning was quite loud so we had them turn it off and the toiletries were a bit naff, but if these are the only things one can moan about, then it shows how good a hotel it was! Rooms are fairly trendy - funky lights - low level LED's in the shower etc, lots of Zebra wood and flat screen TV's, white marble bathrooms. Lovely Mojito's on the roof terrace overlooking the sky line and staff happy to chat about life in Barcelona. It is situated about 10 mins walk from the main shopping area, and there are plenty of little cafes surrounding it. I would recommend this hotel to friends and will be looking at its sister hotels when i go to Madrid or London next year.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely incredible boutique hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: xichic
Reviews.Content: I was completely impressed by this boutique hotel. It was stylish, quaint, well appointed to as in furnishing and toiletries, great staff, nice and quiet bar and pool scene. Location is not prime, but it is definitely not bad. This hotel is located only 2 blocks from the Uriniquoa metro stop (which takes you pretty much anywhere), and it is only a 7 minute walk to Passaig de Gracia (where all the high end shopping and Gaudi's Batillo and Casa Mila is located). If you are coming home from the clubs, a taxi will be your best bet. The hotel is located in a quiet part of Eixample. As 2 women traveling,we felt safe walking late in the evenings after dinner. The hotel has comfortable beds, clean bathrooms, great flat screen tv, and a nice balcony. My only complaint is that we had little control of the air conditioning controls. We were there when it was quite hot in Barcelona, and need more cool air than the hotel had set it on. The pool is small, but cute, and the bar upstairs is great, and very lounge like. I did not try any of the restaurants, so I cant comment on the food. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you do not mind the quiet location.

Reviews.Title: “just ok...”
Reviews.Author: caetanomi
Reviews.Content: Hotel Granados 83 is a less luxurious copy of Hotel Urban in Madrid. I stayed there for a couple of days and the room was ok and quite stylish but nothing more. The food i had as room service was really disappointing such as the staff that didn't seemed to interested in helping out. I would say its a hotel that you will forget after a week and never come back to.

Reviews.Title: “Immmpresionante!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kshalla
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because I've found that the "design hotels" group is always fabulous! We stayed only one night, but it was amazing and they offered us room 209 that has a huge terrace with a small pool. We didn't use many of their other services but the front desk staff was extremely helpful and the location fabulous. We lived in Barcelona for 5 years and this is one of our favorite streets. BTW- almost right accross the hotel is a lovely wine shop.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect - Avoid noisy 6th floor!”
Reviews.Author: Dubdee2
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this hotel - the decor is amazing and the rooms very comfortable and clean. However if you are booking rooms here, make sure they are not on 6th floor. There is a lovely roof terrace bar at the top of the hotel which was the floor above 6th. There's a huge amount of noise from chairs being dragged around the roof terrace, which is particularly bad at night. It actually woke us up from our sleep on many occasions and went on well into the night. Out of a party of 7, the others had rooms on other floors and had no such complaints. That said, I would have no other complaints about his hotel. I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. I thought the breakfast was a bit steep at €16, however some of our party indulged and said it was well worth it for the choice and quality of food. We all ate at the hotel restaurant one of the evenings and enjoyed it very much. The hotel room itself was perfect - very comfy beds, curtains that work on a switch mechanism and a complicated but cool lighting system where you can play around with different levels of dimming. From a design point of view its ultra-modern and quirky but doesn't lose anything on comfort in the process. The standard ot cleaning was excellent - rooms were attended to twice daily and sweets left on the bed each day. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona - the location is good, a little out of the centre but not too far out - taxis usually cost about €5 to La Ramblas and around that area. The prices in the hotel bar are very expensive, but there are plenty of places around to indulge in a cheaper tipple - cocktails were better value at €10 and delicious!

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who visits Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Katie_lou2284
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spend 3 hours choosing the right hotel to stay at in Barcelona. I'm so glad we spent that much time as Hotel Granados 83 was truly amazing. Away from the main tourist areas of Las Ramblas and Placa de Catalunya (but still just a short 10 min walk away), the hotel is set in a peaceful road close the metro and train network, and also the Passeig de Gracia. There are lots of great restaurants near by, which are definitely worth a visit, and unlike the Ramblas area, feels very safe to walk round at night. The rooms in the hotel were fantastic - spacious, beautifully decorated and well kept, with a team of staff who go out of their way to help you. We were most impressed by the concierge team who were really friendly and helpful. They have a great knowledge of all things Barcelona, and were able to recommend to us everything from the best place for Tapas and Paella, to the sights to visits away from the rest of the tourists. Maybe the only thing which was questionable was the pool as it was a really tiny dipping pool, however still situated on a beautiful rooftop terrace (complete with bar and an interesting assortment of music!!), which was perfect to cool off at the end of a day of sightseeing. I would (and have) recommend this hotel to anyone who visits Barcelona. It was great not being down at the hectic Ramblas, and the location made it so easy to get everywhere. Pay this hotel a visit!!!

Reviews.Title: “Granados 83 Definately stay here!”
Reviews.Author: tiggsey
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3 night stay in Barcelona where we stayed at the Granados 83 hotel. A fabulous design boutique hotel that looked better than its photos (first time i have been able to say that!) The room was inpeccably clean and very comfortable and stylish. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a great location, away from the over touristy Ramblas area and minutes way from the Passig de Gracia and Ramblas de Catalunya. The latter being fantastic for outdoors dining. The hotel has a small room top pool and terrace bar which was very welcome after a days sightseeing. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Barcelona as it is great value for money

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location, and value!”
Reviews.Author: ElizHog
Reviews.Content: The Granados 83 is a really great hotel. We stayed there 13-16 July and had not one problem during this time. It's in a great location in the L'Eixample district and is up the Ramblas from the heavily tourist populated Barri Gottic district (we visited here one evening but found it too hectic for a relaxing weekend in BCN and headed back to our hotel's district to relax!). We felt the area where the hotel is gave more of an insight into Barcelona life with less hustle and bustle and a lovely relaxed atmosphere in the area. The hotel has a very comfortable, trendy New York loft style. There's a great terrace bar and swimming pool on the roof which is great by day to catch some sun and enjoy a drink while relaxing and by night it's great to return up there after a meal for a night cap in the balmy night air with some cool music in the background. FOOD: The reception and bar staff are 'very' helpful - just ask them for recommendations for where to eat and you won't be disappointed. Over the three nights we stayed we ate near the hotel. The nicest meal we had was in 'Windsor Restaurant' a few blocks from the hotel. Try the DELICIOUS gastronomique/tasting menu (€70pp incl wine) - I would say the nicest meal I've ever had! Have a drink in the Dry Martini bar near by before your meal. Very stylish place and a great way to start the evening. They have lots of different types of martinis and they also do other cocktails including a delicious Bloody Mary and beers etc. Also excellent is the more expensive (but worth it) La Dama Restaurant for fine, delicious food and excellent service (€100pp meal and wine). Finally, go to Cerveceria Catalana for excellent tapas and a wonderful atmosphere - we ate here on our first night as we were looking for something light on arrival - grab a place at the bar or wait for a table - again all three of these places are a stroll from the hotel. Overall Barcelona is a great place to visit for a weekend. Do take the Tourist bus (jump on anywhere and buy a ticket) to get your barings. It's a wonderful way to see the city especially in the summer where it might be too hot for too much walking - The Parc Guell is lovely - our tip, grab a sandwich and drink on the way there (a street on the way uphill has a supermarket on the left near the top of the road). We thought in hindsight it would be nicer to grab a quiet place to sit and eat in the shade and enjoy the nice atmosphere and music playing around the park than sit at the cafes which are perfectly good but busier. Le Pedera is probably best visited earlier in the morning. We passed by in the morning and there were no queues, later in the day the queues were very long. Have a great time in Barcelona - everyone seems very friendly and are not just putting it on for the tourists - we were very impressed by the service we received from everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique in Barca”
Reviews.Author: ARDNAHOE
Reviews.Content: Part of the Derby Collection (including the Claris Hotel), this central Barcelona hotel aims for the hip and trendy but is a good base for anyone touring the city. Located in the semi-pedestrianised C. Enric Granados you can walk most places you would want to see in central BCN. Front of house can seem severe in that Spanish kind of way but tend to be helpful. Spaniards do not tip -nor do Catalans - so a few Euros gets you better service. Avoid the deceptively named Executive rooms - I checked mine before signing in and upgraded to a standard double. "Executive" gets you a small tho pleasant room but with only an internal window onto the main lobby. The street is quiet at night so no real noise disturbance from there. But I was disturbed and you may be too -the hotel rooms are trendy but wooden floors and industrial decor mean little noise absorption and i needed to get up and get some earplugs as I finally worked out at 4 am those loud voices were not an adjoining room but referred noise from the ground-floor bar. Very pleasant rooms and bathrooms: well-appointed with attention to detail. There is a great gastro -cafe across the street and if you want a simple steak and chips head out the main door and turn left for 50 feet. The "pool" is a minute lap pool and to use the plunge pool you need to navigate the lovelies in the unprepossessing roof top terrace bar. Gym is minute! Avoid the expensive in-room breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: bdron
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks great, but the walls are paper thin, and it does not have the facilities expected of a 4*Superior hotel - e.g. no tissues in the bathroom! On our first night we had people in the next room partying until 5am, and we could hear every word they said. Eventually we got moved by security to another room to sleep for the remaining few hours of the night, since the staff were not that interested in getting them to stop. We got moved to a suite which was smaller than the room, and quite inconvient as it was split on 2 levels. The manager, Jon Mateos, and some of the staff are very arrogant and not helpful. Over-priced.
